Reviews.Title: “Outdated And Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Erick F
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night with my wife and was greated by a friendly front desk person( so far so good) On the way to the elevator we obseved bangs and dirt scuff marks on the sides of the elevator entrance(not good). Once in the room, large purple stain in the carpet near the end table. The following morning in the bathroom what appeared to be blood stains on the wall. On the side of the end table I found a trail of Fruit Loops that led from under the bed to a cup full behind the end table.( is there any quality control here?) The clothes closet with a broken hinge and the thin plywood back pushed out exposing all the nails. I called the manager,who inspected the room and promply apologized and changed my room. I have stayed at many Holiday Inns before, but nothing like this one. "The Wilson Family" should see this place for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle4589
Reviews.Content: When I checked into my room, I wasn't a happy! My ac was broken! I called front desk and they sent up a maintenance man. He said it had to defrost it would take about three hours. So yeah I left the room immediately!! Went to front desk and they switched my room right away to a beautiful room. With a pool view and a working ac unit. I.feel that for the location the price's are fair..Oh and the pool is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Awful awful awful!”
Reviews.Author: FrankieL110
Reviews.Content: I typically don't find anything wrong with Holiday Inn but this one (I feel) needs some updating and good scrubbing! I've been at Holiday Inns that were rated 2 to 2.5 stars that were in A LOT better shape and a lot cleaner than this one. I booked the room on Priceline and nowhere was I informed about a $5 + Tax resort fee per night until after I had checked in! I have to say, their ice machine also needs some maintenance. Got some ice to keep milk cool and while it looked find in its frozen form, by the time it melted there were HUGE black flecks in it! Thankfully I didn't put ice in any of my drinks. All I can say is EWWW!!!! As an update, it's now 11:30pm at night...and the front desk just messed up and assigned my room to another guest! They had a key card and everything! Luckily, my security bolt was done but seriously??? Their excuse was that they had a big group to deal with. So what??? Another update (it's currently the morning after). I woke up with my room invoice slipped under the door with a complimentary breakfast voucher to apologize for the inconvenience. It was so much more than an inconvenience! Maybe for the other guest but it was a complete breach of privacy and security for me! Especially traveling alone and being female! Talked to the assistant manager and am got the resort fees and one night comped. BTW, she had no clue that this had happened at all! Still not happy since it should've never happened in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Please read IMPORTANT - .”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie529
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late and was greeted by very friendly front desk staff member and a security officer therefore I felt this is going to be a great stay. HOWEVER There is a $6/night "Resort" fee. Nothing about this Holiday Inn says "Resort"; however that was NOT nor IS my issue. The hotel is old and has not been updated. The room, 2 queen beds: smelled musty, two lamps didn’t work (1 had no bulb). Carpet was filthy; my husband and I wore socks in the room the entire time inside. Curtains had mold and stains throughout! A/C Unit cord had been spliced and wire-nutt'ed together, totally exposed. I saw it when I dropped my glasses, picked them up and saw it. We did bring it to the Managers attention who promised to have it taken care of. After we came back later in the day, we looked and was amazed on how it was fixed. I went to the front desk, saw the manager and asked him to tell me how it was fix... because I could not believe my eyes as they pulled up the carpet and covered the spliced cords and wire nuts. The manager said that's how they fix it. Talk about a fire hazard. Immigration - Visa - Passport renewal day was held at the hotel where hundreds of people came to complete paper work or be interviewed... they were all lined up down the hall, in front of the elevators and allowed to roam around freely in the pool area, etc. Again it's a "RESORT"? No privacy. Housekeeping - arguing, yelling and fighting on our floor. Dirty towels left in the hall way by laundry. We refused service the day before we left because we found that housekeepers go through and open all rooms to be cleaned, flip the latch to keep them unlocked all day even when housekeeping is NOT on the floor. Security found one room left open over night across the hall from us. Parking - you are going to walk to get to the door. Tour Buses - stinky and loud. Woke us up in the morning. If they offer you the "pond view" room, don’t take it. It's like a ditch and a parking lot - very ugly. Customer Service person next to Alamo counter in the hotel SELLS TIME SHARE! Want a free map; well enjoy your 3 hour (not 90 minute) presentation tour. Several guests warned us. So, it's a cheap hotel. You can get better elsewhere. If you have children, please do not bring them unless they have had their shots!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great rates, service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyalli2
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for Spring Break for a week. We recieved an upgrade to a Kid Suite (Queen and set of bunk beds) because I am a platinum priority club member. Thank you hotel and these rooms were great! OK - things we loved. Really nice pool area. Great if you have little kids because there is a wading pool about 1.5 feet deep. The larger pool was cool because the sun doesn't hit it for very long this time of the year. Could have been warmer, but oh well. Kudos to the hotel for promptly fixing a light that needed repair, actually 2 lights. There is an A&W and Pizza Hit Express inside the hotel. We only used the restaurant for breakfast and not lunch or dinner, but it is a nice feature if you just want to hang by the pool. The location is fantastic, especially if you are doing Disney. We didn't this trip, but there is a shuttle service too. (Sorry, we didn't use this either this time.) Tons of excellent restaurants in the immediate area!!! This is a big bonus! Walgreens and Publix also very close by. Staff was also excellent and very friendly. Let's face it - this makes or breaks your stay! (Loved Stephen at Front Desk!) Loved having the fridge in our room. Needed it anyway for medicine and we got one included with our kid suite. Things just OK - Parking is fair. The lady that writes about 2 football fields is exagerating. It's not that far. The walk does us all good. Parking lot does fill up late at night, but it's Orlando. You'll get that anywhere! It's really not that bad. We were on the front side of the hotel (Route 192 Side) We didn't have a balcony we could sit outside on where everyone else does. Didn't really matter to us, but if you want one...don't pick that front side. You do not hear noise from the main road either as long as you keep your sliding door closed! No problems there! Overall, fantastic stay! Would definitely choose this property again. There's alot of options on Orlando/Kissimmee area, but rest assured with this one! It'll make you happy!

Reviews.Title: “Really Small Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: BrianGNC
Reviews.Content: This place has small bathrooms. I spoke to 2 other guest and they thought the same thing. Poor design. Hotel overall was ok. Having a food court is a plus after travel to the parks. I wouldn't stay again. To many other choices to put up with a the small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ecatarina_888
Reviews.Content: The price is worth the stay. Although this place is not pricey, get your loyalty card and enjoy more discounts. The parking is free for guests and the beds are comfy and very clean. I love the fact that every floor has it's own vending machine and ice freezer. Everywhere I go in the US, I check in at Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “once again another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: carolecleveleys
Reviews.Content: been back to the Holiday Inn again and had another great stay.. Staff were very obliging and friendly. Room nice and clean. Lots of spring break kids but they did not bother us at all . In fact they were really well behaved. Been to this hotel for the last 20 years so that says it all. Look forward to returning in October. To anyone not been before I can recomend this hotel and it is very central for all attractions. Well done to all the staff who know us by our surname not carole..Cannot see why anyone would have cause to complain!

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: therese d
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very clean, and convenient as we were staying there to visit disney. the staff was friendly, service was prompt. check in was easy and check out was easier. our rooms were cleaned daily. i felt safe. i really have no complaints. i would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying just outside of WDW”
Reviews.Author: Spaghetti6
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last month. They are very "kid-friendly" and the staff worked hard to accommodate all our requests. Rene in Sales, the Front Desk and the restaurant staff all did a tremendous job ensuring that the rooms and breakfasts were outstanding. I appreciate that they made special "to-go' boxes at 4 am so that our group could have something to eat before an early morning transfer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: DorvalBuddy
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - Spacious and clean rooms; very pleasant staff, big pool for the older kids and parents (although located in the shade) and a wading pool for the small ones; small playground next to the pool; arcade for the kids; restaurant on site (not recommeded for breakfast - a bit pricey and the food not all that great; try any of the near-by buffets or the IHOP). Great Location - just a short distance to the main entrance to Walt Disney World; 20 minute drive to Sea World; across the street from Old Town and Fun Spot (rides and arcades); plenty of restaurants in the area;1 hour drive to either Cocoa Beach to the east or to Tampa St-Petersburg-Clearwater to the south west. I would highly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: shamel16
Reviews.Content: It's always confusing reading these reviews because it seems like the people aren't visiting the same hotel. After reading the reviews prior to my trip yesterday, I still went ahead hoping for the best. The plus was they did let us check in around 1:30 p.m. when they said the room wasn't going to be ready until 4 p.m. As we walked off the elevator on the 8th floor the ice maker noise was very loud and the hallway was very warm. We entered our room that we were so excited for because we reserved a kids suite - and sadly disappointed. It looked like they tried but things like stains in the carpet and a mound of dust on the lamp shades made the experience not as good. The kids were so excited for their bunk beds which I have no complaints about. The AC was so loud and incredibly insane that it blew right onto the queen size bed directly. My husband wouldn't sleep on that side so I had to and thankfully I brought my kids' blanket to wrap around me head so the cold air wouldn't go straight on me. A plus for it being loud though was it drowned out the noise of the street in front of the hotel every time it went on. And since the ac was located in the window - the kids complained it was hot since there was a half wall in between them and the ac. We tried to spend the day at the pool yesterday but the pool is right behind the main building which gets no sun so it was too cold for the kids even though it was advertised to be a heated pool. So my kids had to hang out in the kiddie pool which was warm since it was in the sun's path. We had reserved 2 nights but after not getting any sleep the first night we cancelled the second night. Everyone was super nice there but that's not enough when you are hoping for the best vacation. I would not recommend this hotel. The night advertised was $109 and by the time the taxes and resort fee it came out to $138. I will spend a little extra money next time to go somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “family trip”
Reviews.Author: lguenther
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, the room was so so it was clean enough but we had a "corner king suite" their idea of suite and mine are not the same the bathroom was just too small, the kitchen area was adequate for what it was but would paper towels or napkins hurt the bottom line that much? The breakfast in the hotel is awful, pancakes, french toast was cold and the eggs are like rubber with about as much taste, didn't have any biscuits and gravy so they may have been better? no whole wheat bread the first day and the choice of yogurt was blueberry or peach all 3 days there was a nice variety of cereals, and there was fresh fruit but for the price we finally went to Ihop down the road and had food we could eat. The pool was nice and kept clean the hot tub was nice and hot and clean plenty of towels, but just a pool nothing really to do for the little ones, but they kept themselves entertained. overall not bad for the price my only real complaint was the food, really how can you ruin scrambled eggs?

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect for our needs-some improvements suggested"”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: After travelling many hours with a 2yr old and an infant, we were excited to finally reach our hotel. It was conveniently located across from Old Town which was fun for us to walk over to it. The room was neat and clean and the beds were very comfortable. My only complaint would have to be the bathroom. The shower curtain was a bit dingy and there were some dust bunnies or cobwebs (couldn't tell) behind the toilet. Also the light was very dim and the fan was loud . We wanted to leave the bathroom light on at night but the fan was way too loud and it didn't allow you to shut the fan off without turning light off too. The beds were extremely comfortable! Would recommend otherwise...

Reviews.Title: “Poorly kept rooms”
Reviews.Author: hayden8
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we found some trash items in our room from stay's before. We only had one trash can in room which, with two children, ran over daily. After a couple of days of 60 % cleanings we called front desk and complained . They said we would get a VIP cleaning with all the waste pails added that room was supposed to have and even replaced a broken hairdryer.Next to last day we did not get any room service at all .. One thing you will notice in rooms is an envelope to place tips for housekeeping. This is hard to do when room is dirty when you arrive. Overall value ; rooms are small, bathroom is tiny , no microwave .Housekeeping would not refill daily in room coffee. Lines always at front desk with usually only one clerk so better to call from your room for service. Will not stay there again. Too many other choices in area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Misleading Price”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Maingate East. I chose this hotel based on decent reviews, and because of the price they advertise in the travel saver books. There is nothing wrong with the hotel. It is very clean, with comfy beds, and the staff was very polite. We arrived after a long day at Magic Kingdom to find that they were not accepting the coupons they advertise in the travel books! Now, what is the point of having a coupon if you will not accept them?? The advertised price in these coupon books were from $49.99-$69.99 but we ended up paying $130 for one night!! Expensive for a one-income family! Now like I said, beautiful and very clean hotel, but not fair that they wouldn't take thier own coupons!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kinya C
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I am just sharing a review for this hotel seeing as though we stayed there 2 years ago, but I guess because I just left disney again in February 2012 I realized that I never reviewed the Holiday Inn. If you want a place to stay that is great on price so that you can have more money for shopping, then this is the place. The lobby was beautiful, the employees were nice, the playyard for young kids was small, but it served its purpose for a very young child, the arcade was cool, and the rooms were extremely clean. If it were not for my husband I would have stayed here again on our 2012 trip, but hubby wanted the kids to experience a disney resort which cost us about $450.00 more for the same three nights. When we stayed at this Holiday inn in 2010 we only paid for 2 nights and they gave us one night free. I loved it here. Now that the kids have experienced staying at a resort, I think our future trips will be back to this hotel because you can beat the price for such great service. Also this hotel is right across the street from old town and plenty of eating. All the places to eat are within walking distance, literally like a 2 minute walk to many food places.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: WSMom
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our recent stay at Holiday Inn Main Gate East. I only have a few deterrents from our stay. 1-parking was a real problem. When arriving back at the hotel after 9 pm, don't expect to get a parking spot anywhere near the front building. Two nights in a row, there were trailers taking up more than 6 spots each, further adding to the parking issues. Parking is essentially free (unless you consider it part of the reasonable resort fee) so you get what you pay for. 2-the size of the bathroom in the double deluxe queen room overlooking the pool. Your knee should not be hitting the bathroom door when using the toilet. There was not enough room in the bathroom to get dressed. 3-food seemed pricey, the Pizza Hut was much more expensive than walking across the street to the actual location. With the McDonalds practically in the hotel, we mostly ate there. 4-the business center was pay per use (of computer per minute, printer per page, and fax per page). We have stayed at many other hotels where this was free. As for positives, the hotel was clean and quiet. My family loved the pool although we wished the architects had thought it out better to allow the pool to actually be in the sun. Game room was nice for older kids and the workout was well equipped. Great free wi-fi. Be aware tht if you check in on Sunday but don't connect your device until Monday after 12 pm, that you will need to get a new password from the front desk. Very convenient to Disney properties. We will plan to stay here again but will opt for the kids bunk room (larger bathroom, comes with a fridge, and has 2 TVs)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MommamurphyFlorida
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times. It's ok. Nothing to brag about though. Don't try to check in even a little early. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We were upgraded the last time we stayed to a king "suite". It had a small kicthenette, no dishes or anything. There was a microwave and frig which was nice. Small bathroom. It was nice to be down at the end of the hallway away from the elevator this time. From our previous stays we have found that the elevator makes a strange noice that no one at the property seems to hear. We told them about it and they looked at us like we had two heads. Now we ask to be as far away from the elevator as possible. The pool is nice and they have a hot tub and a exercise room. They try to sell you time shares in the lobby after you check in so beware of that. The breakfast buffet is ok. Not worth the money they charge. The continental breakfast part came with our room price and if you paid a small amount more you got the hot part of the breakfast also. We did and all that was included extra was overcooked eggs and breakfast meat, grits and overcooked homefries. There was a large group that had a whole section of the dining room reserved so the seating was limited when we stayed this last time. There is also a Pizza Hut in the hotel.There is a McDonalds right next door which is nice if you want to get a quick bite. Many other restaurants are very close by. It is also right across the street from Old Town. If you like going there it is nice to be able to walk cross the road and not have to take your car with you because the parking can be difficult over at Old Town. This location is not very far from Disney World and not a bad place to stay if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: The location is great, as it is centrally located to all of the major theme parks. We booked our reservation through a third party and was quite pleased that the manager on duty (Obada Yassin) was so friendly and accommodating even though we were 6 hours late checking in. The only fee we had to pay was small per day resort fee which was clearly disclosed and signed for prior to checking in. We booked a QUEEN KIDS SUITE. The room was exactly as seen in the photos, neat and clean. Quite frankly we thought what we paid for what we got was a great value. We will continue to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will return.”
Reviews.Author: TDBArizona
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms,good service. I come to Orlando for an annual convention. I have stayed here for the past 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of additional fees here....”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, check in was friendly and efficient... There's a little expensive shop next to reception, the concierge is friendly but will try to send you on a timeshare meeting in exchange for a free theme park ticket! I upgraded to a king suite, it was a nice room - very clean, lots of space, a nice sitting area, a small kitchenette but no plates or utensils provided! The bathroom was very small though! It was nice to have a balcony overlooking the pool... They have a really nice hot tub outside and a small gym! I didn't take breakfast at the hotel, there's loads of eating places near by, I was lazy one night and stopped by their pizza hut which was really good! Wifi was free, which was a bonus, as was parking... The common areas look a bit dated, and it's definitely a family hotel - but it's worth staying if you get a good rate! Be aware of lots and lots of extra charges, I'm not sure why you have to pay a resort fee, it's not really what I would describe as a resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Main Gate East”
Reviews.Author: pilotfxe
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Hotel front desk are very friendly. The employees in the fast food dining area...not so much. Over all the hotel is OK, but needs to be redone. The rooms are dated, and the beds are so soft, when you sit down, you sink into a hole. They are just plain worn out. The bath rooms are fair, but need a good cleaning, kind of ditry. The TV's in the kids suite are older than me. If you are just looking for a place to stay, and not spending much time in the hotel, it is fine. The overall property is old, and needs to be redone.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Love2getaround
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place to stay. It is large, with more than 400 rooms. As with many Holiday Inns we have experienced, it shows its age just a bit, but not to distraction or discomfort. Convenient to I-4, it probably is the cleanest one we have enjoyed. The friendly staff seemed to be constantly mopping, sweeping, wiping down,etc. Ample free parking, and, blessedly, quiet, even though our room was on the first floor not too far removed from the pools and playground, and there were lots of teenagers around. We asked at check in for a quiet room , and they delivered. Free WiFi worked well in our room and in public areas, and the fitness center was adequately equipped and very clean. Our "standard" room did not come with a micro or fridge, although a micro can be rented. Some other rooms, presumably, are so equipped. A pleasant surprise was the high quality of the food. While Pizza Hut has a small operation in the food service area, the restaurant itself is part of the hotel, and puts out three quite ample buffets per day with a good range of offerings. Not your ordinary hotel/motel food by any means, and thereb is an apparent willingness to at least try to take care of some individual needs, if someone has a dietary restriction. The servers in our dedicated dining area could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We were participating in a week-long adult continuing education program, taking our included meals in the hotel. All members of our group were complimentary of the freshness, quantity, and range of food selections.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: irishblue812
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating and the room was nice as well. You will be hard pressed to find better value in the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TDAVIS03
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Kids Suite which overall was a pretty good. We were not expecting 4 star quality at a Holiday Inn and the overall stay was pleasant and I would definitely recommend or stay there again. The hotel staff (front desk, bell hop, maid service) were all very nice! The room offered plenty of space. The beds were comfortable - soft. If you like a firm bed you may not like them. The bathroom (shower/toilet) was very small but if you are not to modest, just leave the door open! LOL The beds were comfortable and the A/C was just right - not too cold/hot or not noisey - some reviews complain about the A/C but ours was just fine. The refridgerator wasn't very cold but we didn't use it anyway. Parking was a little bad - the hotel was booked up the weekend we were there so we had to park out by the street (within view of our room) but I was just being lazy and didn't want to walk after being at park all day. The hotel seemed to be clean and offered a bar, game room, & buffet. We did not eat the buffet (didn't have time) but everything looked good. If you are on a budget and not looking for 4-5 star quality this is a great place. We also received a great rate by calling and not booking online. We saved $35 dollars a night by calling.

Reviews.Title: “Average amenities, decent price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: This is a typical "average" hotel. Nothing fancy. OK service. Room smells clean, but bathroom had noticable black mildew stains on cauking around tub. It is nice to have the ability to open balcony doors and sit outside. Pool area is nice. On-site bar was handy, but the bar-staff was not experienced with making drinks. When issues with the room were brough to the attention of the cleaning staff (i.e., only 1 bath towel, trash left in dresser drawers by previous guest, etc.) all issues were promptly resolved with a kind note.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: neptune12088
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok to stay.nice pool hot tub,clean rooms.Nice place for kids.Staff very friendly and helpful.What I did not like was there was no dead bolt on the room door and you can pretty much hear the people in the next room.But I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You get a bit more of what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is not bad. The pool is nice, there is a playground and it is nice to spend some time there while not in the parks. The rooms are pretty good, the A/C is old and noisy. The TV is a flat screen but no HD signal which is a bummer nowadays. Pillows are horrible, if you are driving, bring your own pillows. There is a McDonalds in the car park which was handy after a late arrival and there is a food court in the hotel itself offering fast food (including Pizza Hut express). You can walk in to a few restaurants, but I have not tried any of them. At this location they usually host teenager tour buses and they are quite noisy. The rooms don't have too much insulation so you can hear everything from the connecting rooms. if you get late at night, good luck finding a parking spot. They allow buses and RV's to park here and they take many spots, forcing you to park on the grass or in some unsafe location. The price is good, you get a bit more of what you pay for, but don't expect too much. Also there are some annoying timeshare sales people on the lobby asking you if you would like free tickets to Disney or cash back on your hotel stay (yeah, right!).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not bad, room wasn't ready so they upgraded us to a different room. There was a dead bug on the white comforter when we went up to room, but at least it was dead. We spent all day at the park on Friday and got back to room late. We tried to sleep in on Saturday but the fire alarm went off at 9 am and we had to evacuate the building, when we made it to the front door they announced it was a false alarm. So instead of some sleep we just packed up and headed back home. Everyone was very nice, a little run down for a Holiday Inn, especially in such a prime location. Probably when use again. We travel to Disney once a month and have not found a hotel that we use every time yet, if the price is right again would use this location.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Sal_UKUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night after landing in Orlando. I am a platinum member of the Holiday Inn reward programme that brings benefits such as welcome gifts, better rooms, lounge access etc but none offered at this hotel. The rooms are large (2 double beds) but looking a little tired if I'm honest, we had large gaps around the door and the furnishings were a bit tired. On checking in we were met with hoards of teenagers that were on an organised tour so were a bit dubious about noise, but we put the air con on in the room and didn't hear a thing. There is a McDonalds in the car park which was handy after a late arrival and there is a food court in the hotel itself offering fast food (A&W/Pizza hut express). For a one night stay it was ok, if I was staying longer would probably shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Road Scholar week”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: This is the largest Holiday Inn in which we ever stayed. I was dubious because of its size and the large numbers of children and young people staying there. The staff is excellent and very considerate. After two nights with problems sleeping because of noisy kids, I appealed to Lizbeth at the main desk. She responded quickly by moving us to a quiet location for the balance of our five night stay. It was a good facility for our meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: qikvette
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before but it seems to be in decline, both in service and amenities. Arrived after 4 PM and were told room was not cleaned yet at first but then miraculously, it became available while my info was being obtained. Upon entering the room, discovered a dirty wet towel on the bathroom door. The air conditioner is extremely loud...could only sleep by turning it off. The bathroom is so SMALL that you must enter (almost step in the tub to close the door) and then only then can you use the toilet. If you have small children and they need you to help them in there forget it if someone is on the toilet, the door cannot be opened without injury. Breakfast is a rip-off....no freebies here!!! Choice is muffins etc for $8.95 or cold eggs/barely warm meats and cereals for $10.95. No complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning. McDonald's is next door and is better food by far if you don't want to drive anywhere. Hotel also had many teens from Brazil lodged there and even the workers were complaining on the elevators about how messy they were. I will search for better accommodations next year and just drive to Old Town for the events there. As a Priority Club member, I was very disappointed. This has to be one of the worst Holiday Inn's in the chain.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE- WHAT A NIGHTMARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shellymust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made reservations at this hotel weeks before our visit on 1/27.We stopped at the hotel at 2:00 on our way to the Mecum Auction. We were told that no rooms were cleaned, but we could check in and pick up our key later. We checked in and moved on to the auction. We returned at 7:30 to pick up our key.There was a line from the front desk to the door. One clerk was working the desk while two others stood in back talking. Finally, after 20 minutes the night manager opened a new line and we were next in his line. We told him that we had checked in earlier and just need our key. He asked to see ID, and my husband said that we had already done that in the check-in process. Instead of saying "That's our policy sir", he went off on us. He claimed that we had called him four names which is not true. He told us we were not welcome there and would not give us a key. He said to find another place to stay and threatened to call the police. We left and will never stay in another Holiday Inn. It was horrible to be treated that way. Thinking about the situation now, the whole thing seemed staged. They probably gave away our room and were trying to get rid of us. One thing they got rid of is a future Holiday Inn customer. A person like this should not be behind a desk in a service industry!!

Reviews.Title: “I DIDN'T LIKE IT”
Reviews.Author: sherrybsc
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on trip advisor prior to booking at this hotel ... they didn't paint a pretty picture but frankly we wanted something within walking distance to Old Town and all the other places were booked (lack of planning on our part). We had been on the road since 5:00a and arrived at the hotel about 2:30p. The lobby looked decent, no one was waiting in line but there were a few people stretched out on the couches and in hind sight they were probably waiting for their rooms to become available. The girl at the front desk had the most unhelpful attitude. We gave her our name and stated that we were checking in and before she even checked the computer to see if our room was available she promptly informed us that check-in wasn't until 4p. When I said "oh, I thought it was 3p" she retorted with "well, we give you until noon to check out". I'm just thinking check-out is the least of my concerns right now and check-in is my greatest. Of course, as you may well expect, after looking in the computer her suspicions were verified. There were, in fact, no rooms available at that time. She offered to take our number and call us AS SOON as a room came available. We never got a phone call and around 4:30p we came back to the hotel to try to check in again. We were waited on my Frank P. the manager on duty. When I booked my room I did request a high floor - that request clearly wasn't accommodated as we were placed on the 2nd floor. The room was spacious but sparsely furnished and dark. Turns out the 2nd floor room we were in overlooked the roof that covered the indoor pool. We had no balcony and our windows were about 4' off the floor and only about 3' tall. We went' back to the lobby and requested another room. The only other room they had was a ground floor room across from the arcade. We actually took this room - which only goes to show how bad the first room was. Our room was a handicapped accessible room. The bathroom was dark with only one light over the sink and no counter space, They provide you with a full lengh mirror in the middle of a dark hall that has no overhead light (gee thanks). The rooms furnishings were ok, the bed was comfortable, the pillows were a joke ... they were smaller than a standard pillow ... they reminded me of a small throw pillow you might find on your couch. There was no comforter just a sheet and a thin blanket - not enough - even in florida. The air conditioning unit sounded like a jet engine when it turned on and when it was off you could hear your neighbors coughing. During the night when you could finally fall asleep you were awakened everytime the air conditioninig turned on with its deafing roar. They offer a breakfast for $9.95/person or you could just walk to McDonalds which is in their parking lot. The location was great for Old Town - just across the street. But my bottom line - I'll try to plan ahead next time and go with another hotel ... for the money I know I can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando vacations”
Reviews.Author: ccamazon
Reviews.Content: excellent location and value, many restaurants, supermarkets and shopping centers nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, oh my gosh!”
Reviews.Author: CatLadyJ
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to say enough about our stay at this hotel! After making the BIG mistake of staying somewhere else (trying to save some money) the night before that we couldn't get out of fast enough... oh my goodness!! The Holiday Inn Main Gate East was literally an answer to my prayers! This hotel is obviously conveniently located extremely close to all of the Disney entertainment, but we were among the rare few who were NOT there for that reason. Anyway, the hotel staff was wonderful, the rates were quite fair, the facility had more features than we could have hoped for. Example- there is an outdoor heated pool, a children's pool , a jacuzzi, a playground, lovely outdoor patio, a mini "food court" they call their restaurant, a game room, a rental car desk, a gift shop- and that's just the stuff within the hotel itself!! The rooms are very nicely furnished. The beds were clean and comfortable ( 4 pillows on each queen size). Plenty of space to move around, spread out or whatever you like. Each room is equipped with a safe for valuables, at no extra cost, which I thought was a nice feature. Microwaves and refrigerators are available if needed, but not standard. I agree with some of the other reviews that I've read about the bathroom area (toilet and tub/shower) being a bit small. The sink area is separate, which proves to be helpful when more than one person is trying to get ready. The bathrooms are set up nicely though. Plenty of clean towels, soap & shampoo. I felt very secure and safe in this location. The rooms are well insulated, so sounds are not a problem if you're a "light" sleeper. Again, the staff, whether it be those at the front desk, the restaurant workers, the cleaning ladies, the bellmen, the maintenance people, the gift shop attendant, the rental car counter, whomever- they were ALL genuinely friendly, very courteous, quite helpful, just an all around "blessing" in a day and age where real customer service seems to have faded into obscurity. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for safe, secure, clean, comfortable, fun and fair priced accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: MRVEGAS711
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Main Gate East is in a great location close to all the Disney attractions, shopping and restaurents. It has all that a family could want as far as clean comfortable room, large property and great pool area. Personally, didn't sleep that well with AC being replaced on the roof above me it was very loud. At night time it was dead silent as the AC would turn off from loud to nothing in a regualr cycle so it was hard for me to sleep. The hotel itself....very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: Eyoung77
Reviews.Content: I never sleep well on vacation but the beds at the Holiday Inn maingate were amazing. I prefer a softer bed so if you like a hard bed don't stay here. We had the kids suite with the bunk bed and it worked perfectly for us. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished. The bathroom could have been a tad cleaner but I am fairly picky. There was some hair/dust in the corners of the floor by the bathtub and that always gets me. I would stay here again. I was somewhat worried because I got a great deal through my work and for what we paid I was so pleasantly surprised. Everyone was so friendly and they really go out of their way to make sure that you are happy. Great place for an Orlando vacation. Great price for great accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal budget base!”
Reviews.Author: Happymummy1234
Reviews.Content: We booked through Virgin and were happy with our 2week stay here. We had a Kids suite on the 7th floor and our children liked the bunk beds and their own TV. We found it to be a great base on a budget. Everything clean and the beds and pillows very comfortable. Bathroom was small but totally adequate and shower powerful. Easy to drive and access Magic Kingdom etc (5-10minutes away) Staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather stay at Disney”
Reviews.Author: tlong07
Reviews.Content: I do have to disagree with many of the comments concering the staff and management. We were able to check in much eariler than the designated check in time and were upgraded to a bigger room. The check in and check out experience was great. Here are a few of the dissapointments we had in the hotel itself: a few extra fees, no towels on our second night-they were replaced very quickly though, no ice in any of the ice machines, had to park quite a bit away from the hotel itself. If you are visiting Disney during an off season and can get a room for around the same price as here I would reccomend the Disney option hands down. When you stay here you have to drive to the parks and pay the $14.00 parking fee each day otherwise you are stuck with the bus hours at the hotel which we didnt use because they were inconvenient with the times we wanted to go to the parks. When you add up that cost with the other resort fees here you really wont save a whole lot. Rooms at the value resorts will be a bit smaller but if your like us you really wont be staying in the room alot anyway. I can say that this hotel served its purpose for our trip but overall I get a much more enjoyable experience staying on Disney property. For me the disney hotels really keep you feeling the disney spirirt even when you leave the parks, when you stay off property you really feel like your disney experience ends every night. I would definently not tell anyone to avoid this hotel, but I would say you can do better by planing your trip out in advance and visiting in a relatively cheaper Disney season and staying on property.

Reviews.Title: “Needs remodeling!”
Reviews.Author: Thesoupnazi88
Reviews.Content: It's pretty bad when your bathroom smells of mildew. Management needs to look into there cleaning staff. The floors in my bathroom looked like they haven't had a good scrub in awhile. Black mildew in the shower. My bed linens had someone's hairs on them. Walls are thin. Air/heating units are very loud. Hotel surely needs updating. The only good thing I can say is the customer service rep was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: klawilliam
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal to stay there, but it wasn't worth it. The front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. We were met with a horrible smell when we got off the elevator. On the first night our toilet stopped up. When I went to take a shower, there were other people's things hanging from the back of the bathroom door that had not been removed. We had the "family suite" which was incredibly small and crowded. The television in the "kids area" was not working properly. When reported their solution was to simply unplug it. We got back late one night from the parks only to discover that we had no towels or toiletries in our room. None. They had taken our used towels but did not replinish. The bathroom was so small that my very tall husband had trouble turning around to close the door. When we checked out they did not ask or care how our stay was. We asked for a cart to help take our luggage down and we finally gave up and took it down ourselves. Parking is way in the back and if you arrive back late you have to park about 150 yards out. Not fun with tired children.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLukeCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Pricey hotel, where you can stay if you don't spend much of the day here. We had a familiy-room, but found it very small, and not even close to normal american hotel rooms in size. Also the overall standard of the rooms are poor, but good enough if you don't spend too many hours on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Indigowaters
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever been in. When we arrived the beds were made...but they BOTH had stains and hair all over them. No ice machine on the floor nor vending machine and I was told there was one on every floor by someone that worked here. Finally found one and it didn't work. Horrible mold smell in the hallway. Tiny bathrooms. And housekeeping leaves an envelope asking for tips even though they don't work for it at all. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: b8uatb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December 2011 and our stay had many issues 1. No bellman or trolley to take our luggage when we checked in 2. Fridge in the room was leaking water 3. Water in the sink won't drain 4. Stains on the comforter 5. Shuttle schedule changed without any notice 6. ANTS in the room This place is the worst hotel we have ever stayed. Customer service was bad.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! COURTYARD DOWN THE ROAD IS EXCELLENT AND THE SAME PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: Girlie410
Reviews.Content: Horrible! Not the standard Holiday Inn. I am very surprised that Holiday Inn allows it's name on this hotel. Staff- warm reception, but that's where the warm and friendly ends. Day manager was okay. Night manager is rude and should not be working in a customer service environment. Hotel staff in general was not friendly. None of them ever said "good morning" or "good evening" when they saw you in the hallway. Washer and Dryer - costs $4 to wash and dry one load. That's very expensive! Housekeeping - they barely make the bed, let alone do anything else in the rooms. I asked over and over again for enough towels for our party. Also there was never enough toilet paper. Restaurant - Always looked closed whether it was open or not. Had to go find an employee to help us everytime we went in there. They were more interested in talking amongst themselves than helping the guests. Food was very expensive. $3 for a hot dog and $12 for breakfast. Then when they finally took your order it took a very long time to get the food. The bar also charged $7 for a glass of wine. Cleanliness - very poor upkeep! The jacuzzi had milky gray water in it. It never looked clean. There was a dirty towel in the stairwell for 3 days before it was finally picked up. Workout area was also not clean. The machines looked like they had never been wiped down. Childrens theater - what theater? It's really just a room with a few chairs and a TV in it. Not a big deal. Location - the only good thing about the hotel. Very close to drugstores, restaurants, Starbucks and shopping. I normally stay at Marriott Courtyards and was asked to stay here due to the group we were travelling with. Against my better judgement, I agreed. I will never stay at a Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: NoNameMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This hotel lacks so many things, it is hard to know where to begin. First, the smell in the hotel hallways and rooms is disgusting. During our stay, there were blower machines in the hallways to either dry out the hallway rugs or to help eliminate the smell. We were not sure what the purpose. The rooms are filthy dirty, dusty, containing food crumbs and nail clippings on the floors and in the beds. Ants were found in the corners of the room, and there were not enough towels and toilet paper in most rooms. There is not enough help or service in the food areas, and the food is less than mediocre. We will NEVER step foot in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Returning again”
Reviews.Author: cruise147078
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and returning soon. It is in an excellent location within a couple of miles to Disney World. Clean rooms, pleasant employees, with a speedy check-in/out process. Many sit down and fast food restaurants nearby. You can grab a bite to eat before entering Disney and paying their prices. You can even see the Disney fireworks from some of the windows at this hotel. If you have your own transportation, there is a Wal-Mart close by in case you forgot something. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you are doing multiple parks”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011, and we did all four Disney Parks, Universal and Islands of Adventure, and SeaWorld. This hotel is conveniently located, it is next to a bunch of restaurants, Rite Aids, anything you are looking for or need. The pool is GREAT, there is a nice hot tub and the lobby has a restaurant in it too. We had a kids suite, the kids LOVED having their own bunk beds with their own little TV. They were entertained every second which is truly priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for Disney - at a fraction of the cost!”
Reviews.Author: Lostpassport
Reviews.Content: Decent holiday inn, no frills but good size rooms, clean, tidy and reasonable amenities including a pool. If you are looking at doing Disney on the busget, this is the place, the real gem is its location, you are so close to the parks and they offer a shuttle service. Food at the hotel was good, basic fare, but decent prices, but across the road are a range of restaurants, so your choices are vast. I woudl really recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again. Just a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: jkn1027
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline, and knew about the resort fee before checking in. Lobby and grounds were nice, they upgraded us to a family suite for free, which really helped us out. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was supposed to be heated, but was rather chilly, although the hot tub lived up to its name. Probably the biggest issue was noise. I know Priceline rooms usually don't get the prime location, and ours was over the front parking lot facing the street. Very noisy, lots of car alarms going on and off, traffic sounds, etc. I know that's not the fault of the hotel, but some better soundproofing would help. The last night we could hear some people talking. Sounded like they were right out our window, but we were on the 6th floor. Couldn't tell where it was coming from. The bed was very comfortable, the room was not cramped. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but the hotel could use some work”
Reviews.Author: gjohns45
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed here for one night and we were not overly impressed. The room we got was fine--clean and well kept, but the hallway to get to our room smelled like water damage had occurred their recently. The hallway also looked pretty worn with multiple stains on the carpet and it felt like there was no A/C running in the hallway. The elevators were scary as they creaked and made weird noises and actually other guests got stuck in them as we were trying to bring bags up to our room. The walk up four flights of stairs to our room was inconvenient but we preferred this to possibly getting stuck in the elevator. On the bright side the hotel was big and seemed to have a lot of options for guests--a food court, large swimming pool, playground for kids, hot tub, and gym. If they fix the elevators and clean the hallways this will be a pretty good value. Also when booking this hotel please be advised of a resort fee that they spring on you when checking out. It's only 4.95 but it is annoying as it seems like it is a tax for booking through Priceline and none of the documentation that is provided by Priceline explains this charge. This place is good for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms BUT NOT GOOD ANYWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: sarah c
Reviews.Content: was booked here for 10 nights, the lobby was nice, rooms were in good condition, clean and had most things needed, exept had no fridge and if u want one u have to pay an extra $5 a day. the air con in the room was very very loud, waked u up every time it comes on and if u turn it off the room is way to hot. the pool area had terrible sun chairs most of them were broken, and if u want to get some sun then dont stay here as there is only a tiny tiny area that the sun gets to (2chairs) and its a fight to get on them, plus its far from the pool. pool was also cold to. but staff are nice! the ones that manage to make themselfs smile.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: milanvora
Reviews.Content: We were given a room where the outside AC was making such a lodu noise that we had to request for another room. Upon request we were given a new room which was much better. But overall quality of room, bed was not to our liking. The bed linen looked like it has not been washed. We can't fault the hotel that it was appropriate for a 3* but nevetheless we checked out. I think there are certainly better properties available. I wouldn't stay or recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: JonJon0
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location 2 times and have enjoyed the cleanliness and proximity to restaurants within walking distance. Easy access on and off the freeway and lots of parking too. On site food court type restaurant area is really nice in the morning and the outdoor pool area has a nice seating section as well. This is not the place if you are looking for lots of green landscaping but it is very nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ajitbhanot
Reviews.Content: Situated about 7 miles from Downtown Disney, this is a very well maintained property, The rooms are spacious and quite inexpensive. The bathroom is very spacious, there is a balcony in the room. Ample parking space, nice pools, The only issue is the breakfast at the food court, at 10 bucks a pop it was quite disappointing, the restaurant manager seemed like he was doing a favor to us by just taking our $$$. The buffet was a bit disappointing. Apart from this the stay was perfect, comfortable beds, good tv channels, near the main area but yet far away from the maddening crowd, it was my second trip to ORLANDO in the past year and I am happy to have stayed here...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I requested a balcony room, and that is exactly what I received. Very clean and they have the BEST staff ever!!! I even got to see the fireworks from Disney from the balcony. I was here for a convention for a different brand, however this hotel suited my needs and was very close to the convention site! The beds were also VERY comfortable! Thank you to the great staff and management!!!

Reviews.Title: “adequate but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: FerTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was part of a JetBlue vacation package. The overall hotel is showing it's age, but it is relatively clean and the staff is nice. Food is an issue. Initially it looked like they have fast food restaurants in the the hotel (Pizza Hut, A&W). However you actually order your food, then they bring it out to you. This takes the "fast" out of fast food. You are better to eat at area places like the McDonalds next door etc. The pool area is big with lots of chairs. Good size adult and child pools. But bring your towels. It was impossible to get a towel from the gym or pool the whole week we were there. We rented a car so can't comment on the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: desiree N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my honeymoon in February of this year for three days and it was great, so great I came back in October while visiting for two days with my son. I always feel secure and very comfortable while staying here. Great location to entertainment, restaurants, and shops, more importantly very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jes903
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and now that I have Disney passes I decided to stay again because they have the shuttle. Well, the shuttle schedule is wrong. The information we were given said the stop from Epcot back to the hotel was #25. After waiting for the shuttle for 20 minutes, along with other people trying to return to the same hotel, we asked a Disney worker. The worker said it was actually #49. My boyfriend and I had to take a taxi back and spent over $23, I could have parked there for only $15! When I explained to the guest service manager about their mistake all he said was no the paper says #25. I told him, his schedule is wrong and I want my cab fare back and showed him my cab receipt. He said he could not prove the schedule was wrong and tried to give me a breakfast coupon instead. I told him no and that I would be calling Priority Club. The next morning I explained to the lady at the front desk again what had happened and how rude her manager was before. Needless to say, I finally got my money back because she called the shuttle company and verified the hotel was wrong. She handed me the $23 dollars back and did not even say sorry. Rude staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...But the toilet paper was sub par.”
Reviews.Author: Lukej93
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn at Old Town is a sweet hotel where me and four of my buddies shared one of the rooms with the bunk beds (AWWWWYEAAAHHHH) while attending the PSP World Cup in Polk City. So here is the story about our marvelous stay at the Holiday Inn. It all started when we originally booked a room at the Celebration Suites across the street. When arrived there we found ourselves a nasty and super muggy hot room with a couch that had what looked to have blood on it. We immediately left that crap hole and decided hey lets go to McDonalds and use their WiFi to find a nicer hotel. When we get to the McDonalds we look up and see the words "Holiday Inn". So immediately we are like heck yeah lets check these digs out. So I we chalet over to the Holiday Inn and ask how much a room was. The totally awesome receptionist writes down this G16 ultra top secret rate down on a piece of paper ($49.99 + Tax) and tells us we can get either a room with two full beds or a room with a queen and two bunk beds. So we ask to check out the rooms. So she hooks us up with some room keys for us to check the rooms out. Well we walk into the bunk bed room (which was literally 64837648263x nicer then the Celebration Suites) and decide thats the room for us without even looking at the other one. So we head back down to tell the awesome receptionist that we will take the room. So she then asks us if any of use have a military ID. Well my buddy Brett has one and shows her and we get $5 off our room making it $44.99 + Tax a night now. Then he is like "yo I got AAA too do you have a discount for that too?"... Well what do you know they do so we get our already low rate knocked down another $5 and end up paying $39.99 + Tax a night opposed to the $60 + Tax we almost spent at the Celebration Suites. So were happy campers now. Well we then go grab some dinner and head back to the hotel. Well this dinner is making its way through me quickly so I decide to make the first of many journeys to the bathroom in our room. Well here is where my only complaint is... After releasing the bombs into the toilet I go to wipe and what do I face. SINGLE PLY TOILET PAPER. The Horrors! I immediately yell to my fellow companions "This Place Is Cheap! THEY ONLY HAVE SINGLE PLY TOILET PAPER GEEESH!"... Other then that this hotel was awesome. They even have a sweet pool... SEE PHOTO.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: carolecleveleys
Reviews.Content: stayed many times at this hotel and once again everything was great. Clean room helpful staff, great location. What more could you ask. Stayed at disney wilderness lodge in the past but the rooms are smaller there and 5 times the price! Cannot fault our stay and look forward to going again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Eliziam1
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay here. We stayed for 5 nights on our first trip to Disney. Very convenient to all the Disney parks, all within about 3 miles. We didn't utilize the shuttle, as we wanted the flexibility of our own transportation since the shuttle generally only ran once in the morning & once in the evening for each park. But it was nice to know we had that option. We arrived to find an unexpected comp upgrade from a standard room to a KidSuite, which was fabulous- our son loved the bunk bed & having his own TV, & the partition gave us a little extra privacy. (Just keep in mind the 2 TVs are only about 5 feet from each other, so there will likely be a 'battle' for the volume if you're not each watching the same thing.) The hotel itself was very quiet despite a full parking lot, barely heard a peep from other guests in our hallway. The in-house Pizza Hut & A&W were a nice touch, we got pizzas our first night in & took it right to our room. And the gift shop was also nice if you forgot to pack something, want a quick souvenir, or have the munchies after the cafes are closed. Naturally it's overpriced, but to us that's expected that you would pay for the convenience of not having to leave the hotel. Our son loved the indoor pool, although at only 72 degrees it's claims of being 'heated' seem odd. I've found that other heated hotel pools generally range around 80 degrees. The only negatives (if you could call them that): My initial contact with the front desk staff & reservation staff by phone before our stay was disappointing & unnerving, found several of them extremely irritable, rushed & rude by phone. But we had no problems with the staff during our stay, although most of the front desk staff seemed very 'detached' & gave the impression they didn't really enjoy their job or people, they were still cordial. And we found the front desk girl upon checkout to be extremely nice- she even printed out our boarding passes for us (I wish I could remember her name). The bathroom was VERY tiny- the door nearly rubs the tub when it opens & even as a very petite person I had to scoot to the side of the toilet just to close the door. The room carpets could use a good shampoo. In the main building facing the street, it was disappointing that the balconies were for show only, the sliding glass doors were screwed shut. But these things in no way really diminished the overall enjoyment of our stay. Just things that stood out to us a bit. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay, would recommend this hotel to others, & would stay again should our travels bring us back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Selenes G
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is one of my family's best place to stay when we go on vacation. Their rooms are big a spacious, the beds are so comfortable it feels like you are in your own bed well thats how I feel. I would recommend the holiday Inn any da, year round for any of your vacation stays. And the staff is very customer friendly. Thanks Holiday Inn for making my family's stay so wounderfull.

Reviews.Title: “OK, for the low price only”
Reviews.Author: AlandJaz
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has been remodeled as a Holiday Inn, but it still feels old. It is clean and has food choices, but it felt like we were in the midst of the remodel: the door handle was banged up, the bathtub was chipped in several places, the was no deadbolt, only the hook-lock. The room felt small and cramped, but the bathroom felt more spacious than most. Having said all that, for the $60.00 or so we paid, it served us well. (We wouldn't pay much higher for it). It is conveniently located close to the Disney parks (our destination) and the bed was comfortable. The elevators move remarkably fast, which is great. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations and good location and everyone eager to help”
Reviews.Author: Jaya M
Reviews.Content: Great Experience! Clean nice comfortable room. Everyone very pleasant and willing to help you. Room was very nice and beds were great~ Wonderful property and we will definitely stay again~

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, nice location and perfect to go with the family”
Reviews.Author: wabnikp
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Orlando Hotel is just a few miles from the main gate of Walt Disney World. The price was really excelente almost 49 usd for a cuadruple room. I recommend this hotel for your next stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do the buffet”
Reviews.Author: seriouslycheeseheads
Reviews.Content: We got the suite facing the pool and the room was very nice. The kids room ( ages 10 and 8) had bunk beds and was separate from Mom and Dads room. There was a small kitchenette where we had some breakfast and lunches to save a little money. We tried the free buffet once. It was so crowded and dirty we spent the money to eat away from the hotel. If your kids are older than 7 or 8, skip this Hotel. It is only meant for little kids and there parents. The room however was nice and the price was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Rest but Staff Deserves Credit”
Reviews.Author: RakkmUp
Reviews.Content: I am a little suspect with all of the 5 of 5 ratings that show up after some poor reviews, especially when the raving reviewers only have one review. Checked in and they accomodated with our request - asked for north building (hoping to escape highway noise), highest available floor. Got to the room and beds were in bad shape - concaved mattresses. They changed our room no problem. We got to the new room and beds were fine. Went from north parking lot view to courtyard/pool/rooftop view. Problem is they were next to elevator and you can hear it all. Worse, room had adjoining door to next room and heard everything in the next room. Worst of all was air conditioner noise. Add to that the constant hum of the air conditioners on the flat roof below. Kept us up ALL night. Exactly what we needed for an early rise and full day and night of Disney. Pricelined cheap rate but I don't feel should be 3 stars. Pool and deck area was very nice and even had a great playset for the kids and the main areas of the hotel that we saw were nicely done. Our room was clean and carpet seemed new. Some lampshades had stains (not sure how?). Free wi-fi was a definite plus. Every employee was friendly and polite. You may not care but something that really bugged me was the bathroom faucet had minimal clearance from the edge of the sink so you could not get your hands under the flow without covering the counter with water. Poorly designed. Shower had one of those bath fitters but fine with me since pressure was good. Small fridge and HDTV in the room - nice perk. Last time we pricelined, we got the Holiday Inn on International Blvd - we are disappointed that we did not get that one again. Would likely not stay here again. Liked: Service, Value, Very nice and accommodating staff, Location Disliked: Rooms since NOISY air conditioners and other ambient noise.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping next to a jet engine”
Reviews.Author: jbohun
Reviews.Content: The A/C unit goes on and off all night (unless you turn it off and roast) and sounds like you are sleeping next to a plane about to take off. The pillows are the size and feel of a throw pillow from your college dorm room. I felt like I was sleeping on a old couch in someone's basement. There are much better places near by. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Zen stay, great location, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: luis_jb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is another great holiday inn, clean rooms, courteus people, convinient to many things. Free parking, great an affordable restaurants, awesome pool, friendly people

Reviews.Title: “Golden Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Parker B
Reviews.Content: We spent our 50th wedding anniversary at Disney World, staying at the Holiday Inn Main Gate, Kissimmee, Florida. Frank Pacienza (Guest Services Mgr.)and all the hotel staff went out of their way to make it a very special time for us, one that we will never forget. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Owen1962
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in this hotel over the Labor day weekend for a short Disney trip. Since we have two toddlers, we reserved a kids suite with two bunk beds and a separated adult area. The hotel has a nice lobby with a room for kids to play and watch TV. Our suite is spacious and clean with a mini refrig and a safe for convenience. In addition, kids eat free. Next to the hotel is the McDonald. A lot of restaurants and business are within the walking distance of the hotel. And it is only two miles away from Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Chrisla2082
Reviews.Content: I managed to get this hotel for less than $40 a night by booking on Priceline. You could not ask for a better hotel for the price. The hotel has a nice sized pool, a very convenient eatery on the lobby floor, and if it suits you, Alamo car rental in the lobby. There are many restaraunts and shops around and some provide discounts with your room key. The only draw-back was that our room had a roof view of one of the buildings, and it was littered with clothes, shoes, and old pizza boxes. Overall the hotel is very convenient to Disney World Theme Parks, and check with guest service desk for tickets. If you go to the desk the day you check in they offer you a resort preview that will save you a significant amount on park tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AndiS77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to meet our family who were in town for a dance competition at the Swan. We were a bit apprehensive as we usually go for higher rated accommodations but we were planning last minute and on a budget and this was what we got for what we bid on Priceline which ended up to cost half of the listed price. The building is off the main road and right next to a McDonalds, not my gig but probably great for families. There was ample parking in between and in front of the two buildings. Check in took about five minutes and the staff was very nice. We walked to our room which was in the second tower behind the main tower you see from the road and where you check in. We passed the pool area which was simple but nice. The room was clean and spacious with a large bathroom done in neutral granite. They had Bath and Body works coconut lime shampoo and body products which were nice. The bed was super comfy and the bankets were soft...we slept very well and normally sleep on memory foam. Our room overlooked the pool area and the main road with a mini amusement park, The room had a balcony which we didn't use but was nice with chairs an a small table. We did use room service for breakfast one morning but they lost our order and we had to call 35 minutes later to get it delivered quickly which they did. Nothing special but the eggs were real which was nice as scrambled eggs cab be egg substitute sometimes. We did use the pool and were laughing at how tiny the pool towels were that they had availalable...seriously it takes at least two towels to cover a sun lounger which definitely needed covering as they weren't very comfortable. The pool was very clean but not heated...they even had a sign that said specifically that the pool would never be more than 78 degrees. It wasn't unpleasant but took a few minutes to adjust to...lol. Overall we would recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charis S
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here with some of the reviews, but we didn't have a choice since we won it on priceline and were able to get a GREAT rate! We had a great stay, the room was clean but as other reviews state the bathroom was small and the air conditioner was loud...but these details didn't bother us at all. We didn't see any bugs, and couldn't hear other guests at all. The pool was our 8 year old daughters favorite along with the hot tub, and they also had a smaller pool for toddlers that was only 1 1/2 ft deep. Children are free with a paying adult at the breakfast buffet, the food was fine but the bacon wasn't the greatest. For lunch and dinner they also had good selections with A&W and Pizza Hut along with other items. The location is prime, there are a lot of places to eat within walking distance, or even a short drive. There is a $5.95 resort fee each night, but I knew this from reading the reviews. I am not sure how they designate this a "resort" since it is pretty typical to other hotels we have stayed at, but as I said we rec'vd a great rate, this added cost didn't phase us. We did not check out the arcade or the children's theater.....to busy in the pool and the surrounding area! Old Town was just that....old :) We walked around and had dinner at Boomtown, TexMex (very good) but thats about it. We didn't feel that it was in a bad area, of course we are in our early 30's but could see how Old Town could bring some questionable people to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: BadshahofGoa
Reviews.Content: Great location in Kissimmee on route 192 - very good choice of restaurants and diners and close to most theme parks. Our room was of good size on the 8th floor and so very quiet. Basic rooms although housekeeping was good and kept it very clean. Front office - especially Annette- was extremely helpful. Very helpful staff at Guest Services. We looked forward to coming back each night after a long tiring day. Will certainly stay there if we decide to go back to Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “better value found elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SmithvilleWorkingMom
Reviews.Content: Rooms were noisy as doors stick and so you heard many slamming doors. Charges as a resort but no true resort features. Advertises in AAA for free continental breakfast but be warned they will not honour this unless you book ahead through the website and the ad does not state this.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it sounds”
Reviews.Author: erinsnook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Main Gate East and honestly, the service was great and the room was fine. The bed was super comfortable and the A/C worked great. The pool was well maintained and hardly ever busy. I would reccomend going to McDonalds right next door for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is good but it's $10 per person. The shuttles only run once a day and our driver wasn't particularly friendly. I would reccomend renting a car while staying. A taxi to Disney is about $27 for the whole car ride one way. The shuttle only runs at 8 am for Magic Kingdom and 10 am for Epcot. Parking is only $15 at the parks! Bring your own stroller if you can it's $15 a day at Disney. I have no complaints about the hotel. It was very warm in the hallways but there is no a/c in the hallways so it is to be expected in a warm place like Florida. There was a few scratches on the wall and stains on the floor but that is to be expected at a well stayed in hotel of this rating. Don't expect the Ritz for $50 a night and it will be a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe Holiday Inn lets this property fly it's flag”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: This facility need a complete make-over. Perhaps the people that have rated this as a good place to stay do not have experience traveling and perhaps are on a low budget. The carpets are dirty (cannot imagine walking barefoot in the rooms), it smells musty everywhere, etc. The front desk staff was good. Holiday Inn headquarters needs to make an emergency trip to meet with owner of this property about what he/she will do to keep the flag. There are plenty of other good properties nearby including Holiday Inn Express. Get off 192 if you want some advice. I am a local who just needed to spend one night there while our home was being painted.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: wales45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Feb/March 2011 when in Florida for the Launch of Space Shuttle Discovery. I travelled with my 11 year old son and initially we were given one of the kids suites. I suppose they might be ok if you are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids but for us it was not a good idea. The bathroom in these suites is tiny and I mean minute!! The room overlooked the front of the hotel and the traffic noise from Highway 192 was unbearable. Fortunately we were able to move to a room at the rear of the hotel which had two double beds and a big bathroom. This room was so much better and we could have uninterrupted sleep without the traffic noise. we only stayed at this hotel as it was a package with Virgin holidays U.K and we had to take it as we had a voucher for £600 off the cost. In hindsight I wished I had paid for separate flights and been able to book in at an Hotel in the International Drive/Universal Blvd area where I had stayed previously. This hotel is so much nicer in every way than the H.I.M.East. I won't say the name as I want to keep it secret although I've written a review so you can track it down. The Holiday Inn was ok but nothing more than ok and it won't see us returning as there is far better available at better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: klbdmb
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. This is the second time I stayed here. We checked in and we were given a corner room with a fridge and microwave. The room was huge, the bed was amazingly comfortable and the location was quiet. My only complaint about this hotel is that the bathrooms are very small and there's a faint odor in there. I think it's because there was no exhaust fan in there. The location is great for people wanting to visit any of the Disney parks. There's a lot of places to eat in the general area and there's a grocery store and pharmacies close by too. Across the street is Old Town, which is a small shopping area, rides and mini golf. This hotel is good for families! I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fine stay”
Reviews.Author: FinnLinz
Reviews.Content: Family room was nice with kids section and 2 tv's. Nice location for disney and shopping. Large pool area but very crowded and water rather hot. At extra cost Hot or cold breakfast buffet option was good.Free internet. Front parking always full but more parking in the back at 2nd tower. Had a great 'Birthday deal' get the 2nd night free. Many spanish guests.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Huttiheita
Reviews.Content: Nice location for old town in kissimee and not to far for walt disney/universal either. A tip is to find a magazine ( which is all over and easy to get) to get a coupon for the hotels. makes you save some dollars.. Paid 60 usd pr night for a room.
