It is also smart to get a room to the backside (, more quited and the fans at the front was quite noisy , so for a relaxing room..pick the "back' All in all a good hotel for a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations - okay location”
Reviews.Author: tataylo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting the parks with a tour group. I really enjoyed this hotel. No complaints. Friendly staff. Beautiful hotel - completely renovated. My only issue is the location. It's right across the street from Old Town and near lots of restaurants BUT the area seems a little run down and depressing in comparison the the International Drive area. Old Town is a ghost town during the day and only fun for about 30 minutes. Don't get me wrong - there's lots to do within walking distance but I was skeptical about venturing out too late due to some sketchy characters hanging around some stores during the day. But this has nothing to do with the hotel - of course. Overall a wonderful visit to Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: meowzeroni
Reviews.Content: Finding a parking spot was a nightmare, but they let us use the company van parking spot the first night we got there. Everything else was great! The McDonald's next door was open 24 hours, including the dining room, which was cool cause we got there really late and were starving. Our room was super clean, and had a kitchenette with a fridge and microwave. There was also a very nice flat screen TV. We ordered room service for breakfast in the morning, the veggie skillet, it was delivered right on time, it was hot, and delicious! Everyone was super friendly, the beds were comfortable, the pool was sparkling clean and not too cold. We really had a great time and would definitely come back despite the parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “Line the floor with towels, or have black feet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump! First we could never find a parking spot. Circled the building a million times. Yes the lobby is remodeled, but who cares unless you plan to sleep there. The room was so dirty. They need to fire the maids who barely do surface cleaning. My room had a dirty towel in the bathroom, gum stuck to the wall, and a pop tart behind the bed all found at check in! Don't chance it like I did and think this is an isolated incident. The hallways were also riddled with trash. And they call this a "resort" because they have a pool, and non existence parking, and laundry facilitys?? They charge $4.95 a night for this. Enjoy your well deserve holiday and stay somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: amby1891
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn main gate east is nicely located near the disney main attraction with easy access to all disney theme parks. However, the hotel itself is quite poor. While the rooms are still relatively ok (apparently some renovation happened in the last few years), anything else is very poor. The a/c in the room is noisy and hard to control. The elevators are old and seem to break on every trip. Breakfast was very very basic and at a low quality. The only other good thing going for this hotel is that it is relatively cheap. Another proof to the saying "you get what you pay for".

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: skullmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel recently and were not impressed with the room or hotel mgmt. Reservations: Set-up was a nightmare. We had to be transferred multiple times to get the reservation set up. Yelled at by hotel employee from Accounting over the phone. Very frustrating. Room: Mold on ceiling in room. There were bugs running around. Loud neighbors who continuously tried to open the door that adjoined the rooms and poor sound proofing made it hard to get a decent nights sleep during our entire five night stay. The balcony had a build up of water from the a/c that turned to slippery slime (safety hazard). Mold and black growth visible inside of tub when taking a bath. Not the nicest thing to see while relaxing. Staff: Only nice staff that we encountered was the bellman named Brando. Frank (Asst GM?) was also very helpful. Accounting staff not friendly or helpful. Front desk in general was not speedy. I expected more from a hospitality standpoint being in Kissimmee. Half the staff did not speak English, would knock on door even if the do not disturb sign was up.The staff at front desk and in food court seemed more interested in continuing their personal conversations than in attending to guest needs. We had to practically beg just to get change for the $2.00 a load washer and $2.00 load dryer. Very rude staff. I felt that we were bothering the staff when we needed basic assistance or services. Housekeeping yelled back and forth in hallways making it hard to keep our infant sleeping during the day. Housekeeping blocked hallways with their cleaning carts. Amenities: We were charged too much during visit to the Pizza Hut in lobby food court. Slow service on every visit. Ridiculous service and less than ideal room make this one a no-go. Stay anywhere else on 192.

Reviews.Title: “Its Ok!!”
Reviews.Author: airplntech
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there a few weeks ago . The family room with the bunk bed is very convenient for the family even though is small. This room has a small fridge wich is very convenient. Room Seemed clean ,however the room had a couple lights burned out. Here goes what i didnt like. After a long day at a park we decided to go to the pool. to relax for a while and just like us there was another group of people winding down and maybe drinking a cocktail. I had brought down a beer in a cup. and was sitting there relaxing when a woman that works at the bar aproached me and my wife in a rude manner. and unprofessional. to tell us that it was against the law to drink at the pool and that we needet to take drink out of the property right now. Since i saw her so upset i went to speak to the manager about her attitude. and to ask him where were the pool rules at. To my surprise he told me that he had put it there himself. But iguess the only place he could hang the board was behind the building instead where nobody can see it. Come on people if you want your guests to follow rules put them right at the pool entrance where visible. And stop hiring bitter people that cant deal with guests that are on vacation. Have to give you credit for calling me back with your concern after i filled out the comment card .. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: millionairemk
Reviews.Content: Our family reunion was held at this hotel and the accommodations were perfect. In addition to the eating facilities at the hotel, there are plenty of other restaurants within walking distance of the hotel as well as an amusement park located across from the hotel (close but not too close where you would hear any noise). The staff was very friendly and accommodating. When booking your arrival, please keep in mind that check-in is at 4 p.m. and there are no accommodations to store your luggage if you arrive early and your room isn't ready.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us with Great RESPECT will return!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamaro12
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was AAAAAAA plus ! It was great the first time I walk in I was greeted and ask how I was doing. For the pictures from the web doesnt give how beauitful this Hotel is..I was early and my room was ready for me to check in. Everyone was wonderful and very polite. For example we needed the night staff help, they fix anything we ask. This will be a return visit. And the price was unbelievable it was worth me telling everyone. I will return.... Thanks for making my trip a great vacation....All Smile This Way....

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Ghetto Gate East”
Reviews.Author: mississippi64
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Holiday Inns and have been very pleased. Unfortunately, this one is not one of them. It's an older hotel with a very bad face lift. Everything about it is beat up. The carpet in our room was very dirty. The sheets had a red stain on them. The bathtub had a few hairs from the previous guests. The sink and the tub didn't drain well. My feet actually stuck to the floor when I was getting into the shower. The hotel was filled with lots of families (ours included - it is Disney World), but I found that many of the kids were let unsupervised. I even had to break up a soccer game in our hallway after 10pm at night. I've you have the choice, I would select another property in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: kdmia
Reviews.Content: The Kissimmee/Orlando area has expanded a lot over the last 25-30 years. This hotel is located in the area that, originally, was the only one offering hotels to tourists visiting Disneyworld. It is a long strip of convenient restaurants, mini-golf, go-carts, drugstores, and t-shirt shops. It is also close to the parks (Universal and Sea World are a little further on I-4). However, although I did go there just prior to the 4th of July weekend, this hotel was just too crowded. Check-in was fine and the hotel people were nice, though. The rooms were fine and it seems each has a balcony; beds were comfy. I don't know if they were so full that the cleaning staff felt rushed but I found a half-empty water bottle behind the curtain (not ours), the bathroom was mostly clean but there was a hairball in the corner, and the sink also had a remnant from a prior guest. We were close to the elevators and I had to keep the a/c on high all night so I wouldn't hear the faint sound of the elevator and the people walking down the hallway (hubby is a light sleeper). I wouldn't stay here again. Although the $109 a night (with all taxes) included a pretty extensive buffet breakfast (quality of food very so-so), I would still stay somehwere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Insect bites.Will not come back!!”
Reviews.Author: rputra
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my baby 17 months stayed from june 28-july 05. On july 03 when I woke up I feel itchy skin because of insect bites. I'm not really sure because of bed bugs or ants or mosquito bites. I can't find bed bugs but I did find a big ant and killed it and I show it a manager on duty his name is Frank. I filled out some report with him and he asked me if I want to go to see a doctor. But I said I can take it. And We moved from room 1822 to 1522. But the next morning my wife got bites on left and right leg. We tried to found that insect but can't find it. And we let the manager Frank know again. And again he ask us to see a doctor but it's july 04. It's a holiday and doctor office closed. The manager a good guy only the hotel not good. He also gave us some benefit for free resort fee and we should check out before 12pm but he let us stayed couple more hours. Before we go back to new york, we do laundry all our clothing and bags because we were scared those insects coming with us to our home. Not really a good experience with those things. Luck my baby was ok. One more thing wifi not really good enough if you stay on 8 floor !

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dsbaltz
Reviews.Content: My mother had booked a room at this hotel about 2 weeks in advance. When she arrived, she had to wait almost an hour to get access to her room, which from the start is confusing as this had been booked for a while. The room should have been ready. Furthermore, the lock on the door to her room was broken, and she had to wait while someone tried to fix the door lock. Unable to fix the lock, the hotel decided to assign a new room to my mother, which she accepted. But when she got to her room, there were obvious signs that the room was still dirty. There was other people's hair on the bathroom floor, counters, beds, etc. My mother brought this to the attention of the front desk, and they said the manager would be there in 5 minutes. 15 minutes later, my mother went to the front desk as no one had come to the room. She proceeded to explain that she just wanted a clean room, and that she didn't want to cause any problems. The manager finally arrived at the front desk, and at this point, my mother was quite frustrated with the whole ordeal. The manager claimed that he had looked at the room and there was nothing wrong with it (he obviously didn't look too hard). And what's worse, he even had the audacity to retort lines such as "do I look like someone who cleans rooms" at my mother. This is completely unacceptable. She was not able to deal with this situation without becoming upset, and her voice did raise in the lobby (with good reason, as she had been waiting for quite some time now, and the front desk staff was greatly unsupportive and not helpful). The manager had the audacity to call the police and kick my mother out of the hotel. She is a priority club member, and her only request was a clean room to stay in. How can you call yourself a hospitality service when you reject customers in this manner? This all could have been avoided if there had simply been a clean room for my mother to stay in as she had reserved in advance. End of story. I don't know how someone of this character was allowed to become a hotel manager, but I work as a Quality Assurance Engineer. It is my job to study quality and implement it in the work place. What this location of your hotel has done is completely unacceptable and unforgivable. I am filing this complaint just to bring it to the attention of a higher corporate level that this hotel location on the night of 7/6/2011 had a very incompetent front desk staff, and an even less attentive hotel manager. I understand that it is the peak time of year and hotels are busy around 4th of July. But the way this situation was handled was completely unbelievable, and I am outraged to hear of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: lizzie23092
Reviews.Content: We booked a package through the airline & this was the closest hotel to Disney property that was offered & that was also in our price range. Overall this is a good hotel, did seem to be recently renovated, the pool was very clean & the employees seemed to really go out of their way to be friendly & helpful. They were also really working hard to keep the place well maintained - were cleaning & sealing the brickwork out front & also installing a new terra cotta roof in the pool area while we were there; these ongoing projects did not effect our stay at all but was good to see that they strive to make this a well maintained facility. The main pros were the price - felt it was very affordable & also the good proximity to Disney. after reading the reviews here, we knew not to rely on the shuttle & rented a car, but had no problem with the drive to Disney. We have small children & were easily able to come home mid day, rest & then go back later in the day without feeling like we wasted much time driving. We have spoken to others who have stayed on Disney property & the time it took for us to return to our hotel was comparable to theirs. Also felt there was reasonable availability & variety of restaurants nearby, good for families & not being held "captive" to Disney high prices for meals. We went to Pacino's Italian ( a bit pricey but good food) next door, the Ponderosa Steak House, Cracker Barrell & Chick Fil A were good choices for us. Target & Publix are also close by for groceries. The staff was also very prompt about bringing up a crib to our room when we asked for one, no charge for this either. The main negatives: the Kid Suite room that we had was very small & confining with the bunk bed set up. I know we probably could have been moved to the other building with a bigger room (based on reviews here) but since we arrived late in the evening & wanted to get to the parks the next day earlier, just wasn't worth the effort for us. Also, the bathroom was very small & really smelled of mildew. There were lots of groups of teenagers there when we were, making a much noisier environment than we would have liked & the pool was always very crowded & loud in the evenings. There is very little that the hotel could do about this & understand that they need to fill rooms, so if you are looking for a place more quiet & tranquil, then this would not be a good place to stay during the summer months when kids are out of school. Overall this was fine for our trip to Disney & really helped to make a trip on a budget, but will probably look elsewhere for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome "Mom-cation"”
Reviews.Author: JCaravello
Reviews.Content: My family asked me where I'd like to spend my birthday/mother's day celebration and I could thlink of no other place but at the Holiday Inn Main Gate East in Kissimmee. This is, in my opinion a home away from home. The hotel management and staff go above and beyond making you feel right at home. They are very professional and very polite. The rooms as well as the entire hotel facility is very clean, kid safe and secure. They have an Olympic size "heated" pool, hot tub and kiddie pool. Telephone responses and requests are answered in minimal time. A mini amusement park, sit-down and fast food restaurants as well as gift shops are in walking distance. There is an arcade and min i television theater as well as exercise gym, gift shop, restaurant and conference rooms within the building. The rates are really reasonable and the staff will follow-up with whatever your needs may be. As a famly hotel, I give this place aces across the board. I am a real customer and not being paid to say these things. I'm a guest there at least twice a year and can't think of any other place that has something for each of my family to enjoy. JOB WELL DONE MAIN GATE!!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM WILL BOOK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: ibookyourtrip
Reviews.Content: Was scared when 1st drove up looked old from outside. but Inside was new and clean .staff was very friendly. my room was very clean and new looking. Great price when I booked it at AAA auto club south. when in port charlotte office got a better price then doing it myself. near everything right a cross the street from old town.

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid...won't be back...possible bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Instlouie
Reviews.Content: Okay, so i have this uninvited guest in the form of what looks like a bed bug walking across the 2nd bed i wasnt using. I killed it and got worried so i pulled off sheets, lifted mattresses and didnt see any more so i thought it was ok and an isolated incident. Hoping it wasnt bed bugs. Next morning i am finding more in the kitchen area (i had a suite). I let management know and went about going to work and asked them to inspect. When i get back there is a note in my door that i need to change rooms and to come to the front desk. They give me keys, no explanation of what kind of bugs, no apology for any inconvenience, and not even an offer of a free bottle of water for the trouble. Bugs in my room and all i get is you have to switch rooms. My bag and clothes are currently being treated in plastic bags in my garage, at my expense, because i have no idea what kind of bugs they were...i suspect it wasnt good news or they would have told me i had nothing to worry about. Can you believe i got no apology, nor any offer of good will? I wont be back...this is a crap hotel but in a convenient spot. Ps...free wifi but useless. Slowest worst wifi service i have ever had and it was intolerable to try using it. And i was there on business and needed to work.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay whilst visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: KandTYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner visited this hotel on 7 June 2011 for 2 weeks and were pleasantly surprised. We were a little apprehensive since this was the second cheapest hotel we could book and afford at the time. It turned out to be a spacious, clean and welcoming hotel, a stone throw away from Old Town which is literally across the road (the old car cruise on a sautrday is great) It was also located in walking distance from a variety of restaurants. we flew with Virgin, our resort fee and florida state tax fee were waivered which was a lovely surprise since this usually catches you out! There was a free of charge safe in the room, hair dryer, iron and ironing board as well as a mini kitchen and full size refrigerator. The rooms were cleaned every day - and if we woke up late and missed the cleaners, they would check later and clean the room later on in the day. The pool was clean and so was the jaccuzzi. There is a pizza hut inside the hotel , and they also offer a breakfast, but with IHOP, Dennys and a load more resutarants down the road it isnt really worth having it in the hotel for the price of quality. Although we didnt use the free shuttle service to the Disney parks I did enquire and they had two departure times 0810 and 1000 and two pick up times 1800 and 2200 for Epcot and Magic Kingdom. Overall we had a pleasant stay and when you are spending most of your days walking around the theme parks this hotel is more than enough for a comfortable base to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but review your options”
Reviews.Author: Brownfam41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 on a family trip to Disneyworld. The kids suite room was exactly what we needed. It is not very spacious, but it does allow for some separation between the kids sleeping area and the adults. No need to worry about having to turn your own lights off as soon as the kids are asleep. The one thing I would not recommend is dining here. Our first night there after a long plane ride we encountered a somewhat rude restaurant manager who informed us they were too full and busy (NOT) to serve us. We thought he acted this way since it was 15 minutes before closing, however every other attempt to eat there resulted in a very long wai even though there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. We certainly did not take advantage of the Kids meal deal while we were there- it just was not worth the hassle. The pool was nice and front desk was polite, but the restaurant left a bad taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rbunner
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience from the moment we arrived. The staff at front desk (Melissa) exceeded our expectations and went above and beyond to make us comfortable. We upgraded to a kids suite and my son loved it! The room was clean, bathroom is very small though. We used the game room and ate breakfast there. Location was great, close to M. K and across from Old Town and near lots of things. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convieniently located and more than i could ask for in a hotel.w”
Reviews.Author: hennens3
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel and man was i blown away. I.was really amazed at what you got for your.money. With the economy like it is we try to take a few staycations a year. So when we went to Kissimmee for a weekend and decided.to stop in and check prices we were amazed. It is more than you could even imagine for hotel to have. A kids playground, fitness center, childrens pool, adult pool & jacuzzi. Amazing restraunts and even a gift shop in the hotel. Oh & did i mention a kids theatre.that always has Disney.movies playing..... We will NEVER stay anywhere else but here when we visit anywhere in Orlando. The hotel is a vacation in itself, even if you don't go anywhere else while on vacation!! I hope everyone enjoys it.as much as i did..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dustypersian
Reviews.Content: We always stay here, this being our 8th visit, we find the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the beds very comfortable. There are plenty of sunbeds around the pool with towels supplied. It takes around 45mins from Sanford Airport. The location is great for the parks, also Old Town in walking distance so there is no drink-driving problems. We have stayed in St Petes beach but always spend some days here before we return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: thallgordley
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and very spacious. Did not get to use the pool but it looked very inviting along with the restaurant area. Wireless communication wonderful. Thanks for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experence ive ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Geri2011
Reviews.Content: we got into the hotel after our flight, and we walked into a smiling face, her name is Melissa. she was so friendly and helpful she was able to answer all of our questions or knew how to get the answers for us. she also upgraded us to a king suite for free. it was a lovely room on the 8th floor with a balcony that over looked the pool. the bed there is so comfortable, its was the only time Ive slept in a hotel bed and didn't long for my own bed. the room was very clean, the tub in our room was very deep such nice hot baths after a long day at Disney, i highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay for a night, don't pay for the "breakfast buffet"”
Reviews.Author: nutriguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to get an early start at Typhoon Lagoon. It is very close to the Disney entrance. The room was clean, 2 queen beds and balcony. We were traveling with 2 tired boys of 7 & 11. It was very late at night and checkin, thankfully, was very quick. We paid for the buffet the next morning. $9.99/pp with kids eating free, so total was ~$20 for the 4 of us. It was cheap enough, but the food was awful. I would rate the free breakfast at a Fairfield Inn better than this one. Had I known it would be that bad, I would've ran to the McDonalds next door to get a decent cup of coffee and a biscuit. We didn't say anything, though, we just wanted to get out to the parks. We didn't use the pool or other amenities, although we did still get charged the $4.95 resort fee. We did use the free WiFi though. With so many choices in the Disney area I probably wouldn't stay here again. For the same price I would choose a Hampton or Fairfield Inn where the breakfast is free and there are more items to choose from. The best part of the room was that it had 2 queen beds - not double beds and checkin/checkout was fast.

Reviews.Title: “Just wasn't my style”
Reviews.Author: married2thearmy
Reviews.Content: We visited in June-July for a week during my husband's R&R and stayed in the kid's suite. My son loved the bunk beds and mu husband thought the hotel was great. I, on the other hand was not impressed. The room was very small, wasn't as clean as it could have been, felt very musty and it had a foul smell. After notifying the front desk about the stench they sent someone up who tried to rectify it, but it was still there. After further investigation I discovered that it was the shower curtain. They sent someone to change it and while that did beat the odor down, it was still some left over funk in the room. The hotel was very busy and kind of loud for me, but again, it was on point for my husband and son. There was plenty to do for children and it was close enough to Disney. The atmosphere was just too hectic for me. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to travelers with children who aren't put off by the busy, hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a child friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pandab88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not child friendly. My small child was tired and crying. They sent a security guard to pound on our room door to tell us to be quite! This scared my children. I called the front desk (very rude). The manager never answered. I called the next day. The manager offered me a free breakfast. The last night we were there, they rented the whole floor to a high school basketball team and they were running up and down the halls, yelling, and playing with each other all night. The rooms are clean but VERY small. The table to eat at was ready to fall apart. Our patio door had been nailed shut. We asked 3 times, no one ever came to open it. There is no microwave so this hotel is bad for extended stays. The shuttle bus to the theme parks was 45 minutes late. Once we were in the park we had to leave at 8:30 to make it to the bus stop on time. You will never be able to see the fireworks or night shows at Disney if you are going to relay on their bus service. They did call once we were home to ask us to come back and they gave us some cheap room rate. Over all, I would not stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Well Maintained Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarkBee
Reviews.Content: Could not find if all rooms had balconies or not from their website, so I called, twice. Once was told not all rooms had them, and they were given first come/fist served to people that requested one. The next time, I was told every room had a private balcony. Not a biggie, but front desk staff, or whom ever answers the phone, should know that info. Looks like they were correct the first call. Some rooms appear to not have balconies, all the ones overlooking the pool do have them however. Location is good, short drive to Disney if going there, and a short walk to Old Town, and a good variety of restaurants, even though they are all chain restaurants, there is a good variety walkable. Very friendly staff. I was greeted often by them, from the front desk staff, to maintenance workers, and housekeeping. Very nice folks. Room was a little on the smaller side, but served our purpose nice, and was very clean. The entire hotel, and grounds were clean and nice looking. You can tell they keep it up nicely. The only thing I can complain about, is the railing on the room balcony was dirty, with alot of cobwebs on them. Of course that is going to happen as it is outside, but they should run a broom along them as part of the room cleaning routine, to help keep them at bay. Onsite small Pizza Hut, and A&W restaurant in their food court was spotless. Very clean. Over all, it was a very nice hotel. If I was ever in need of a hotel there again, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every summer. Will always go back.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirlSue
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to stay at this hotel year after year. We really love it here. The location is great, the pools and rooms are very spacious. We absolutely love it. very close to Disney. What else is there to say.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awsome”
Reviews.Author: courtemanche
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly. And the mgt team was great. Very clean. Pool was also great. Food court had everything we needed. Next time I go to florida I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: krystal07
Reviews.Content: I was celebrating my daughter 4th birthday, and man was I glad to choose this propery. The location was great. When my family and I checked in the hotel late evening, they were sold out of king beds, so Annette at the front desk told me they will be glad to change my room the next day. When we went down in the morning our room was not available. Melissa offered to store our bags, that evening when we returned to the hotel Melissa not only provided our king bedroom, she also had our luggage placed in our room and all of our refreshments packed away in the refrigerator. Because our stay was so nice we decided to extend our stay for two additional nights. My husband and I have stayed at many hotels and this is certainly the best. Special thanks to the Front Desk staff Frank, Annette, Melissa and Rohan in the restaurant. Two thumbs up for having a pool for little children. With all said this is by far the best experience my family and I have had. Because of the courteous, and professional staff aboard, I will definately recommend this hotel to all my family members and friends. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose, for the price!”
Reviews.Author: SageBlackie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 13 year old son, stayed in April for 10 days. We paid only $600 per person coming from Canada which included flight and hotel. We were looking for a bargain but we hoped the hotel was clean and decent as the review on their site shows. We arrived and stayed in the kids suite which was supposed to provide some privacy with a divider wall in between childrens side, however the wall did not go all the way to the ceiling, my son stayed on the top bunk and would talk to us from there.(Not very private), The room appeared to be somewhat upgraded but the bathroom was gross! It had a horrible musty smell and the caulking was nasty on the floor(Wear your sandles) beds were good but we had to ask immediately the first day to have all of the bedding changed as our sheets were dirty with ketchup, or bbq sauce spilled, they did so immediately and the room was nicely cleaned for us every day It can be loud at night especially if you are staying in the first tower which is directly beside macdonalds, lots of loud people at all hourse. the gym was ok, it does the trick for short stays, no weights just bike, eliptical and tread mill, which there are children coming in and out at all times playing on the equipment. The pool is good, large for adults and little one for children. Our only complaint was that unfortunately there were a number of underage teenagers as some were still on spring break who were drinking at the pool, and speaking very inappropriately in front of children, my husband spoke up to a stumbling teenage boy who was swearing!! I reported it to pool security so hopefully something was done for any other following nights as we were ususally too busy to get to the pool on time before closing 11pm. Long story short, it worked for us as we were only there to sleep at night, it was cheap and decent. Staff was nice, it was close to most of the parks! My advice is its not too bad of a place, just make sure your sheets are cleaned before you stay, and dont go during spring break if you can avoid it,seems the states have a really long span of spring breakers...teenagers everywhere mouthing off and line ups are ridiculous at every park. Think if we go again, we might just splurge for some luxury elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “another excellent vacation at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolecleveleys
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the years and have always had a good stay. If there is ever a problem the staff have always sorted it for us. We have always found the roome to be very clean. Some reviews ay the bathrooms are small but in tower 2 they are very large so they should have asked to move rooms. We dont have a problem at all with the bathroom but if you were extremely large maybe. Full marks once again. We will be back in October. Would receomend the hotel to anybody and we have stayed in much more expensive ones and not found them to be any better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & great location!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0187
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights whilst visiting the theme parks in Orlando. This hotel is really close to both Universal Studios and all of the Disney parks. We had a car but the hotel also offered a shuttle bus to and from the parks. The hotel isn't the most modern and luxurious in the world, but for what we paid for our stay we could hardly complain!!! The rooms were clean, bright and spacious. The beds were comfortable (we had 2 double beds in our room and that was a standard room), we felt very well rested each morning after a good night's sleep. The television in the room had hundreds of channels and there was free wi-fi. The bathrooms are on the small side but they're clean and the shower was powerful. We didn't use the pool but again it looks clean and it was a good size. We had wonderful views of the Orlando skyline from our balcony. The car parking at the hotel was free, which we really appreciated as we then went down to Miami and had to pay $25 a night for parking at our hotel!!!! I'd really recommend this hotel. Its in a great location and the beds are comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Way to small”
Reviews.Author: SexyMom71
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando for four days with my hubby and our twelve year old daughter . Requested the family suite paid additional thirty dollars. The room was very small. The bunk bed was nice touch but it is just a wall as a partition. The bathroom was way to small trying to close the door while sitting on the toliet was unbearable and forget it if someone was really using the stench was in the room . The staff is very friendly but, the room could have been cleaner. The tissue in on the sink was bunched up like it was used and my husband ithe toliet paper was like that as well.Also didn't appreciate the extra charges added to the bill. Met up with family while there and they stayed at the Marriot Residence Inn . They stayed in a suite that accomodated three adults and four kids. Much better and more accomodating . Next time I go to Orlando I will defintely stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Roc368
Reviews.Content: I checked in 9pm, when I went to the room the room was a mess and dirty. I went back to the front desk and demanded another room, I was given another room, this room had a refrigerator that didn't work, and no microwave oven. I called and reported it to the front desk, they said they would replace the fridge but if I wanted a microwave I would have to pay an extra 6.00 per day. I tried to explain to night manager that they advertised a free microwave on Orbitz but he didn't want to hear it and was very rude about it. The next day I spoke to the day manager and after arguing about it, he finally agreed to give us a microwave. Room service was terrin

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay again”
Reviews.Author: Momaruski
Reviews.Content: The first 2 rooms they put me in the sheets on the bed were dirty,1 had a bug along with black fuzz and the second had black hair on the sheets, the carpet was filthy. The carpet in the elevators was filthy. The clothes dryers didn't work property the exercise equipment was dated and didn't work properly. Very little lighting in rooms, the 3rd room that I was put into on 1 of every 2 outlets worked. No double locks on the doors, did not make me feel very safe. Went down for a drink on Thursday night and they were out of EVERYTHING that they advertised, all the mixes, all you could get is beer or wine.

Reviews.Title: “TYPICAL”
Reviews.Author: DOUGETTASUE
Reviews.Content: Just return from a trip with the marching band. I wasn't that impress and it supports the reason I don't like Holiday Inns. Housekeeping we had was great but others I heard complaints. Restaurant charged for breakfast. Ice and pop vending machines were not available on every floor. If you want snacks, you have to go to the excellent gift shop that is available. The only courteous staff was the front desk and the gift shop. If you decide to stay here, visit the gift shop. It has everything at much lower prices than Disney and it has your essentials such as meds, snacks, and sunglasses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFundaddy
Reviews.Content: Great staff, nice hotel with many amenities, I would have no problem going back. If your looking for a good deal near Disney you can't get much better for the price. Only $79 and the rooms are roomy and comfortable. Lots of people around in the evening but quite during the day as everyone is at the parks. Pool is good, restaurants handy and priced well. Shuttle service is great but make sure you tell them the night before you need one. Have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ealozie
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel after reading the book "The Unofficial Guide Walt Disney World 2011". With regard to the staff, other then my contact with the late night clerk whom I spoke with at 3:00AM, the hotel staff was very attentive. The hotel's amenties are great - a breakfast buffet is available, a nice pool and even a game room for the kids! I would definately book a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “not satisfied with staff and service”
Reviews.Author: chirag7710
Reviews.Content: Room was nice but staff was not friendly and internet service sucks. internet speed slower than dial up internet speed. i had called to front desk people and they said somebody will come and check and who ever came doesn't know anything about internet speed and was telling me because of pick up hours but it doest matter with anything if u have fastest internet service u don't have any problem. i was so disappointed with service because we had teleconferencing meeting with my company people but i couldn't attend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: yanks011
Reviews.Content: we arrived on march13th check it was quick our room was already ready. the room was very clean . we were on the 7th floor with a view of the pool it was very nice. even though the pool was opened til 11pm at night and usually alot of people would swim late it wasnt really a bother. the pizza hut there was fine and the pizza was good. also there was the contiental breakfast . but for $2.00 more you can have the works which was great. the staff was great.only draw back were the shuttles to the parks they didnt run continuiously only at 8am to wdw and 12:10 and another time. coming back at either 6pm or 10pm. if you wanted earlier you had to take a taxi.but other then that it was great and i would stay there again. there were a decent amount of resturants in walking distance and old towm right across the street that had rides and all little shops. alsoif you took a cab they were very nice.we left on the 16th to go to tampa. also it was a pretty busy week there lot of compitions going on lot of teens and kisa but very respectable.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, nice staff, worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Teanguyen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nigths, March 17th-March 22nd. We had a horrible first day landing in Orlando, but the staff was so nice, they made up for it. I believe it was Brian who helped us. He was able to move us from a double queen to a single King, with no extra charge (but since they were out of King rooms, they would have to move us the next day). He was completely understanding and the following morning as we were enjoying our day in Walt Disney World, they moved our luggage AND food from the refrigerator, into the next room! I guess we got lucky and got the room facing the pool on the 8th floor. Both rooms were clean and well kept. The air was sticky, only because we are from CA and there is not much humidity out here. Anyways, NO bug bites (only ones from disneyworld) and a pleasant stay. We don't like have people clean our rooms while we stay, and they never once pressured us to have them clean our room. OH, here is a nice secret not many budget travelers know of, book this hotel from its ACTUAL website!! We found a GREAT package deal!! Room on other travel websites goes for $100+, we got the room for about $68/night. More money to spend at the parks. WILL STAY AGAIN!!! Love the location!! Close to parks, food, target, walgreens, walmart! Only a few things to complain about, wi-fi too slow to even use, we tethered off our phone and it was much faster, and from our room we could hear the elevators but it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: blackwellgal
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 adjoining rooms at this hotel for 2 nights. After bringing bags to our rooms, we had rooms that were separated by the elevators. Went downstairs for correction & were told there was nothing they could do, as the hotel was booked. Within 15 minutes, another family checked into the adjoining room to one of our rooms! Went down & complained ... again nothing they could do, that adjoining rooms weren't guaranteed & they would do their best to accommodate. Then when asked if we could get a break on the room prices, because somebody obviously screwed up, we were told no, then given free breakfast buffets in the morning. This was extremely inconvenient for us, as we were traveling with 3 small children & grandpa & grandma. The adjoining room situation was the reason we chose this hotel - we did book last minute & finally found adjoining situation available....or so we thought. Hotel says free shuttle to & from disney parks. There is only one shuttle leaving at 8:10, and only two coming back, as 6 something, then at 10 something. Tried to get "tickets" to go to magic kingdom, and were given prices that were $20 more per ticket than at the gate as a package to magic kingdom & universal. went back to room to discuss. Then went back down to purchase "tickets"....no one was at guest services ... front desk gal "had no idea where he was". went back to room. in the morning, went to guest services. when discussing ticket prices - i asked Todd "what do you have for a single day to magic kingdom".... Todd said "what do you have" i said what I had, which was about 6 dollars less than he did per ticket ... he immediately put his price sheet in my face & told me how he needs to charge FL sales tax & how nobody believes him. I was not even questioning him & told him that. He looked at my husband & said something like ... "boy she's a bit (insert word for irritated) can't remember what his exact words were here. I told him that he "sucked" (this is not my usual behavior - he was plain RUDE) .... he said "I do suck".....what a jerk he was. I walked away ... he proceeded to yell at me "enjoy your FLorida vacation"!! Todd then proceeds to tell my husband that they only sell vouchers at this hotel, and that he could not sell us a one day ticket only - had to be in multiples. Which i don't know is true or not......but he was a big rude dork. This hotel in my opinion doesn't have wonderful staff - other run ins with staff were not much better - and building is dated. It's too bad it has the name of Holiday Inn, which is trusted to me as being a decent hotel. oh - and if you want to work out - you are clearly visible while sweating it out on the treadmill to all people traveling to the lobby from your room. my sister in law has already asked me where we stayed, she will be in orlando in July & is going to fit in a visit to a disney park....they have already lost one potential customer. positive? they have comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Stay FAR away from this heap!!!”
Reviews.Author: SlowboatTraveler
Reviews.Content: We arranged a three night stay but left after two. The "food court" was a joke. One little "almost Pizza Hut" that made the worst pizza I have ever eaten. Even the kids - ages 7 through 11 - noticed how bad it was so we threw most of it away. The AC was an old "in room" model that had mold in it that made three of us sick with respiratory infections. The bathroom was so small you literally could NOT turn around in it without stepping into the bathtub. We called it the cave because the lighting was terrible. What's the point of a large closet set AWAY from any light source...forget about a light in the closet itself. With every light on we had to use a flashlight during the day to find anything in the closet and some of the drawers. After leaving a day early I realized I'd forgotten my phone charger. When I called the front desk they had me leave a message with the head of the cleaning staff so he or she could call me back. I left 3 messages. No one ever returned my calls. The person at the front desk repeatedly checked the "lost and found' allegedly used by the cleaning staff for two days, but no charger ever appeared and no one from housekeeping was ever available to talk to me. My son came home with a staph infection and I came home with pneumonia. First time I went to Disney and stayed off-site. Not surprisingly it will be my last. I love Holiday Inn, but I'd advise to Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “It is Very Nice And Beautiful Hotel "Yes/No"”
Reviews.Author: surendra14789
Reviews.Content: Hotel has located in great location with nearest major attractions. I stayed here for three nights. I enjoy the hotels hospitality movement’s like dinner, breakfast and lunch and room service facilities. Its traffic but his bathroom is so small. Hotel has a comfortable bed, computer table, TV, A/C good internet access and a basic phone in the hotel room. And hotels views are looking too what great view form room’s south side window. I think All over is too good but it has a some minus points like small bathrooms, No business meeting room, and no cab facility for the shopping. So you say it’s very nice Or No. Well I full enjoy the hotel and I remembered this hotel hospitality. Finally I say that if you have time for holiday so now come here with your friends and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ditmars1929
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! Regarding the staff, they were extremely polite and helpful. The front desk clerks were most helpful with everything you needed, especially arranging transport. The bar maid at the Chianti Bar and the woman at the newsstand were a pleasure to deal with. The best part about this hotel was the location. Affordable compared to the on-site hotels at the major parks, and right across the street from Old Town, which was so much better than the major parks. There's also a liquor store across the street, which was most convenient after the kid went to sleep. Overall, I'd never go to Orlando and not stay at this hotel again. A very great time!

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and Courteous-Clean and Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: dwh2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for over three at a timme for the last four years. We do business in the area that requires a long stay. Every year, we have been treated courteously and professional by every staff member. They have gone out of their way to accomodate our business needs while we are there. This hotel is conveniently located to many attractions. From the lobby to the pool area to the rooms to the small restaurant on site, it is always clean and tidy. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms with king beds are very accomodating for those who need to work away from the office. The bar staff and food service staff have gone out of their way to make not just us, but many of our colleagues, feel welcome and special. We have observed many families at this particular hotel who seem to enjoy the large pool and playground area. The location and the security staff promotes a safe and secure environment. We honestly can't reccomend a better place to stay for the value and service we received at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mel4u9563
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights the hotel rooms were very nice the staff was above and beyone to make our stay great. the pool hot tub bar meet all our needs plan on staying again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: dawndlyon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice, clean and newly renovated, and the kids absolutely loved the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - lower price is not worth it”
Reviews.Author: JackieT666
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review. But such is my disappointment with this hotel I have to. I cannot understand the good reviews. I stayed here for 2 nights following a work conference, to extend my stay and enjoy wonderful Orlando. I arrived to find I was surrounded by flea markets, bargain shops and dodgy ticket totes. Fine - not a problem but seemed to go down hill from there. My room key did not work and maintenance were called. The maintnenance man could not open the door and his supervisor called. He managed to open the door (with force) and made me feel like an idiot (not good customer service) even though his employee had same problem. If you after healthy food - dont go here. The restaurant/"breakfast" bar is basically a fast food shop - fried food or pizza or soggy fruit is about it. The bar did not have any draft beer working (for which I had a token) so they charged me for bottle beer. Dont expect a beer at lunch time - doesnt open til 3pm I had ants in my room, and the shower water smelt stagnent. To clinch the dreadful review. I had a late flight so checked out on time and left baggage with the hotel - sitting by the pool for the day. Guess what - they messed up and gave my bag to another guest who had left for a hotel 10 miles away. To cut a long story short - I missed my (much needed) flight home to UK, due to how they handled the situation. Whilst they have agreed compensation and cost coverage for an overnight stay and flight transfer - the inconvenience caused by lack of care or concern over my baggage is not acceptable. DO NOT STAY HERE!! - Not sure if I can make it any clearer. There are plenty of other hotels closer to the parks and in a better area. Book somewhere else - please!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tlchalk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at this Holiday Inn and continue to enjoy efficient and friendly staff that are always there to meet all your needs or wants. The hotel is in a very good location with very clean rooms and comfortable beds. The food court is convenient with a nicely equipped gym area. We will continue to stay at this facility. For the comfort, pleasantness of staff, cleanliness, cost, and convenience, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location from which to attend NCRS Corvette show”
Reviews.Author: qikvette
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located across the street from Old Towne where the NCRS Corvette show was being held. The facility was clean, the staff was friendly. The only negative on our room was the smallness of the bathroom. You barely had room to open/close the bathroom door by the toilet. The price for the night was an excellent value with the exception that other than in room coffee, no free coffee or breakfast items were available in the morning. They do, however, have an on-site restaurant that serves a very nice breakfast buffet but for a $$ price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all regards.”
Reviews.Author: MarcLPittsbutgh
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay. The check in process was speedy and the desk staff were very professional. They had a bellman help me unload my car. The welcome gift was a nice touch. Our room was very large, recently remodeled with all the latest conveniences including a choice of pillow firmness. The linens were first class as was the bathroom. The room was spotless and the balcony was handy to watch the fireworks from the Disney parks. I thought the hotel was an excellent value for the price. Only negative was the lack of a regular full service restaurant but the self service area was sufficient and there were several restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I CHALLENGE ANYONE to find better for the price!”
Reviews.Author: StewardessFl
Reviews.Content: You can't get any closer than this to Disney World's front gate, and not be staying at a Disney property. I totally flipped when I first stayed here, saw how nice the rooms were and saw the price. The staff is wonderful, rooms are wonderful, price is wonderful. We have stayed here 4 times in the past 3 years and are returning in two months. It's THE BEST deal we can find!!! Any place else I've seen for this cheap is skanky, no matter where in the U.S. I just checked pricing, and it's STILL low! I thought for sure the prices were low after the renovation just to get people back in the door, and at some point they'd go up to reflect what they're offering. But, no, thankfully not. And last time there I found Mickey pjs I loved for cheap in their lil shop. A FRACTION of what pjs in Disney cost, and these were soo much prettier/cuter. As for the people complaining about the lack of a free breakfast, go to the Denny's or Ihop or whatever it is close by and use the money you saved on the room cost. I will agree the bathroom is of a smaller design, but you can have bigger and pay more elsewhere. Oh, and CUTE Mickey Mouse waffles in restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: armymom123
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for New Year's Eve. We had reward's nights left and booked this room because of it's close proximity to Old Town, where we were going for New Year's. Even though the room was free, the front desk clerk treated us wonderfully. All the staff was great! The room was so clean and the bed, as always at Holiday Inn, was super comfortable. It seemed like we were one of the few people traveling without kids, and they gave us a corner room with a king size bed. The hotel has a small store right in the lobby in case you forgot anything, a nice bar area and a kid friendly food court. We had breakfast there at the buffet and it was good. Very nice pool area and Old Town was across the street and up a block or two. Not a bad walk at all, but make sure you cross at the lights. The room also had a nice kitchenette with a full refrigerator. Nice balcony. Only complaint we had was when we went into the food court for dinner, there was no food out at 4pm and we thought we might be too early to eat, so when my husband asked the girl working there if they were open, she couldn't speak English and we had no idea what she said, so we went to a nearby restaurant instead. Also, be careful of the guest services desk next to the rental car desk. They are there to sell you timeshares and are persistant as hell. All we wanted was a map of the area.

Reviews.Title: “The holiday inn and the manager Frank made my first time stay in Florida the best experience.”
Reviews.Author: mrskerns
Reviews.Content: I love this place its super KID friendly. It's very clean. Clean floors and clean comfortable beds. The best part is that its affordable and to good to be true. The staff is incredibly nice and always there and ready to make your stay great. Especially Frank the manager. He makes this place even more outstanding for you. I have a five year old that was so pleased and satisfied with the experience at the hotel. To be honest I had a better time at the hotel than anything else. This is the place I recommend to anyone coming to Florida. It's a must do. Great location and I couldnt ask for anything better. My needs were all met. They have a playground and pool for kids that are clean as well. Do not go anywhere else but the holiday inn in kissimmee Florida. I guarantee you will love it and you will be that satisfied I promise you its too good to be true!

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault Hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: marcjones84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my Honeymoon. First off the location is amazing, easy to get to all of the attractions. Hotel has a great little shop inside also. Room was spot on, We got upgrade to a top floor room at the back so we could watch the Disney Fireworks which was cool. All of the staff where spot on and very helpful.We have just booked another Holiday to Florida and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't beat the place!”
Reviews.Author: lhouse21
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there a number of times and have never been disappointed. Have had a King room, a double room, kids suite and the corner suite, Every time we have been thrilled with the comfort and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to disney”
Reviews.Author: MCBalletgal
Reviews.Content: This holiday Inn was suprisingly better than most. It seemed that it was recently remodeled; rooms were spacious and very clean and comfortable. It also has inside corridors, hard to come by in Orlando area hotels,which are great for saftey and minimizing noise coming from excited squealing kids at the crack of dawn! There is a free breakfast buffet and food court and the hotel is about a 5-10 minute drive from the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework!”
Reviews.Author: depswife
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good reviews and the free shuttle to the parks. Well, let me start by saying we had no complaints about the hotel itself. The staff was nice, and the room was good. We spent very little time in the hotel as most of our time was spent at the parks, and we returned exhausted every night! The bathroom is the smallest I have ever seen, literally!! My biggest complaint is with the free shuttle to Disney. First of all, when you go to any Disney park, you want to get there when it opens. The first (and only) shuttle does not leave until well after the parks open. Then there is not another shuttle to bring you back until 5:45 p.m. So going back in the afternoon to take a nap is out of the question unless your arrange your own transportation. Then, the last shuttle of the night is 10:15 p.m. which is way before the parks close, and if you do not get there early, you dont get a seat, There were LOTS of tourists pushing and shoving their way on to the bus!! The first night we arranged a taxi through the front desk, so we could arrive at the park at opening. It cost us $27! So we did our homework, and discovered that the city bus (the Link) has a stop right infront of the hotel, and costs only $2, with kids under & free! And...the bus leaves every 20 min! So, this is the way we got around most of the time. We did take a taxi at night a few times, but do not use the hotel recommended one...call Mears taxi! The $27 ride that they arranged cost $15 through mears! Transportation is a huge part of your trip, so be prepared! Also, the walls are very thin, and one night I was kept up until 3am!

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: Angelisty
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the level of service we received at the East Gate Holiday inn. Frankly, you don't expect too much when you pay an economical price for a hotel. Not nowadays anyway. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were neat and tidy. There wasn't that "hotel smell," which usually consists of every traveller that preceded you along with countless fragrances and stuff you might not want identified. There were gracious accommodations wrapped in a warm, friendly, relaxing atmosphere. I always say that "you get what you pay for." this was much more than I'd bargained for, and that, these days, says a lot. Thank you for allowing us the pleasure of not second-guessing our choice of Hotel, and also giving us an option of stay from now on whenever we're in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at for business or leisure.”
Reviews.Author: SouthMiamiPm
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stayat the Holiday Inn and currently visit this location when I am in Orlando. They have wonderful accomidations at this site. I highly recommend those who visit Orlando should stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value and with one problem”
Reviews.Author: oldtwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel three nights after our cruise in Miami. Before our cruise, we stayed at Port of Miami Holiday inn for $130 a night, room was small but the bed was very comfortable. We paid $120 for three nights stay with 2 free breakfast in this Maingate Orlando. We didn't expect much for the cheap price. But it ended up the room was much bigger even with balcony. It is far from the disneyworld and good thing they have free shuttle to save us over $60 R/T for tax. But they only have one pick up in the morning at 8:20am for Magic Kingdom, coming back has three different pick up time. It is very easy to catch the shuttle. There is a customer service desk on the opposite side of the front desk, they will try to sell you discount tickets to disneyworld. Don't waste your time, they are trying to sell the resort. In order to get the discount ticket and you have to spend several hours to listen with them....unless you are interested or have time to do it. I had a complain about the guy who worked at the cafe being ruded. I spoke with the front desk manager. He is no help at all. Next day I talked with the cafe manager and he was super nice and handle it in the professional way. He makes me feel much better after I spoke with him. Here is more information about this hotel. Taxi price to/from airport: $55 one way Restaurant: McDonald next door, two door down is a good Italian restaurant (about $12-15 per dinner) Gift Shop: pently of gift shop down the street(good walk).

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed causing itchiness”
Reviews.Author: twinturbo911
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on priceline as a 3 1/2 star. The location was pretty nice and where we wanted to be for our vacation. However, when we checked and got into our room, we found it very unpleasant. The room was very old and the bathroom was dinky with hardly any space to stand. That did not bother me as much until we laid on our beds for getting some rest after our long trip. The moment I laid, I started scratching myself. The room was furnished with two queen size beds. I asked my wife if she is experiencing the same and she agreed. I informed the hotel staff and they came and changed all the linens. After that we still experienced the same issue. The moment we moved to the other bed in the same room, we were fine. It felt like they may had mites in the bed but hard for me to prove. Towards the end of our stay I moved to Rosen Center on International Blvd and they stay there was awesome. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but be selective about room”
Reviews.Author: naturist888
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for one night after a long drive from Key West. It is located right in the middle of Old Town Kissimmee opposite the worlds highest reverse bungee(it was when I last rode it). It is among shops, restaurants and all that is going on in Kissimmee. The hotel staff were very good and patient about the room they allocated us. Insist on a room either overlooking the front or at the back of the rear tower. The rooms that are facing each other in the middle, no they don't over look each other, can get a bit noisy with the air conditioning units on the roof of the ground floor building in between. The advantage of a room high up at the back is that you can keep an eye on your car as it overlooks the car park and you can sit with a glass of wine and watch the nightly firework display at WDW Epcot. OK you can only see the higher ones but that is quite a lot. The rooms are very good and most seem to have adjoining doors which will be good for families. Can't comment on the food or breakfast as we didn't have it. If you didn't know its about 5 miles from Main Gate East which is a few more miles to EPCOT and MGM. Animal kingdom even farther away and Magic Kingdom is right at the back. Don't think you could walk out the hotel and be at the 'GATE' and then walk on to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTim
Reviews.Content: My son's football team stayed here during the AYF national football championships. The hotel is old but has been refurbished. The rooms are small and the bath rooms are smaller. The staff is polite and helpful. The rooms were clean. Overall it was just fine for my 13 yo son and myself.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped family rooms”
Reviews.Author: FresiaTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the family room and it feeled cramped. Same size as a normal room and there is a 3/4 wall next to the queen bed. My kids like to read in bed before qoing to sleep, but there are no bedlights for them. To be able to see their tv, they hade to sit 5 feet from it. The regular room is a better choice. I really appreciated that they had soft and medium pillows as well. The bed was comfortable. There was no breakfast in the hotel, but plenty of choices are available close by. Just opposite the Old Town, so if you missed some rides in the parks, there's a chance to have some there without the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: gtown116
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Kids Suite which was plenty big enough for two teenagers and us. Bathroom was a little small but adequate enough. Room overlooked Old Town which was a fantastic view and not noisy even though it was a main road. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very quiet but food good. Did not have an evening meal apart from a take away pizza which was within the hotel. Swimming pool and jacuzzi were good. There is a small shop in the foyer that sells anything you might have forgotton. Overall a great stay and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Suite is the best”
Reviews.Author: krishull88
Reviews.Content: We have season passes to Disney and wanted to find a reasonable place to stay for multiple trips over the next year. We have two young children so the kids suite was perfect. The kids loved the bunk beds and they enjoyed their "privacy" with their tv while my husband and I were able to relax and enjoy our tv after a long day at the park. We'll definitely stay here again during the next visit to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Gh321
Reviews.Content: I read good reviews about this hotel so I decided to try for myself. I was not disappointed. The front desk greeted us and quickly got us to our room. We had a nice corner suite that was spacious a clean. The bed was really comfy and I had some of the best deep sleeps there. Amenities included a nice big pool and a jacuzzi which we used to relax after a long day of fun. The hotel is situated not too far from Disney World and there is a free shuttle that drops you off and picks you up. Really convenient and no need to drive. Overall, this hotel was well worth the price and I would consider a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: kat2710
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient. Service was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: screen52ame
Reviews.Content: i arrived late like 1am, and was not given the room i asked for...after pointing it out to the main desk, they gave me an AMAZING ROOM!. It added so much to the rest of my trip to be able to come back to an awesome room! very clean. on my last day there, my luggage was stored for the day so i could enjoy the rest of the hotel's amenities. The people at the desk that day were very sweet, kind, and personable. I will come back again to this hotel. and i would recommend it. i would recommend getting the room with a queen bed in it!

Reviews.Title: “very satisfy, and would return again”
Reviews.Author: hotel2011
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Disney by my self. I initially stayed at the hotel across the street and was very unhappy. We changed to this Holiday Inn and were very satisfied. I especially have to thank Shannon. She made the trip less stressful for me and was very professional. I thought she might forgot my request because she was taking care few customers at the same time, but she did not. I would stay at this hotel again next time when I return to Orlando. My only complaint is about one individual, the tall, pale skin manager who worked past Sunday 6pm. Please try to be more considerate toward your customers, and you forgot to ask the room service to change our light bulbs. We have to call the front desk the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: susie1592000
Reviews.Content: The room was large and clean. The bathroom was big and had plenty of counter space. There was information in the room to help with questions. And the staff was friendly and willing to help with anything they could. I was pleased with the hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is doing a great Job there!”
Reviews.Author: Rumpelstolz
Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff, great Service, Perfect ! Coming Back!

Reviews.Title: “Queen Suites with Bunkbeds are Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: shellyfld
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the bunkbeds at Holiday Inn Main Gate East. I wish more hotels would provide rooms like this. With little kids, it just isn't possible for us to book two rooms and feel safe. This way, everyone slept comfortably. My 7yo on the top bunk and the 4yo snuggled with the 9yo on the bottom bunk. A lot of the reviews I have seen for this hotel complain about small bathrooms. Yes, they are small, but seriously? Who goes to the theme park capital of the country to spend time in the bathroom? Overall, this is a great hotel for young families. There is a nice, fenced playground. There is a 1.5 foot deep kiddie pool next to the big pool. The kid's theater is nice too. They play the Disney Channel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Alrep
Reviews.Content: Excellent service , Jessica, Eddie, Carmelo, Restaurant employees. My room was great, clean, very quiet , Great location , nice pool, great facilities my daughter and I love it and definately will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “don't fall for that”
Reviews.Author: pirateprata
Reviews.Content: The hotel services are not so nice enough that they have to be mentioned ... I have been to many other Holiday Inn resorts and this one just dabbles the name the brand carries ..... To start with : they have no complimentary breakfast ...... the bathroom is just big enough for a person to barely stand there & it stinks ... The BEST ONE ,,, don't fall for the free trips to Disneyland or Gatorland they offer .. The agent(Todd/ Woody) is promoting there new Resort (which turned out to be a residential complex ) . He would ask for a trip to that Resort for 90 mins and you could earn your free tickets ... The trip is supposed to be of 90 mins but it turned out to be 2 hrs in which you are convinced hardly or should I say desperately by another salesman to buy the apartment ... if you don't show interest in buying ... they just say SORRY but you don't qualify for your tickets ... This thing was like such an embarrassment that I felt like kicking that sales rep right at the point ... Just that its a great chain and cheap promotions like this bring resentment in loyal customers like me ... you guys just Don't fall in this trap

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: plsagala
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but Frankie was great and very accomodating. Great room, great rate. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Crispyds
Reviews.Content: I continue to be impressed with the revamp of the Holiday Inn brand. I travel quite a bit for both work and pleasure and I'm finding myself gravitating towards Holiday Inn. The prices are among the best and for what you get- they're an even better value. This last stay near Disney was under $100/night for up to 4 adults and included an ALL YOU CAN EAT hot breakfast buffet each morning!! They even provided shuttle service to and from various attractions which can be kind of tricky in Orlando. The only reason for not giving it a 5 star rating was because the room could have been a little cleaner....ie: the tile floors in the room hadn't been mopped in quite a while and the kitchenette appeared to have been forgotten about. Plus the "Free" wireless internet was spotty and in my room at the end of the hallway it was non-existent. Other than that the service was awesome and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: pttmsw2
Reviews.Content: part of my family(wife,son and grandaughter stayed the night before going to disney world. great location and very nice hotel. would reccomend to any family on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Kids LOVED this hotel, bunk bed rooms are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: matthews4disney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before heading over to Disney's Pop Century for a 9 night stay. We got a fantastic deal on Priceline and I was absolutely thrilled with this hotel. We requested a Family Suite which had bunkbeds. It was incredible! The bunk beds were VERY nice with thick mattresses and that area was seperated by a wall and had its own TV and dresser. The beds were super comfortable, bathrooms were nice and had Bath and Body Works products. I would definitely recommend this hotel! It was super clean everywhere, nice lobby, all great. The only thing I saw was that there were a few dead bugs on the window ledge when I pulled our curtains all the way open. Not a huge deal, but obviously this just hadn't been cleaned in a while. I would definitely stay here again. We love Pop Century, but this room was a million times nicer than Disney rooms...just doesn't have the characters. :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was awesome. They provided with all the services I needed.”
Reviews.Author: shereeross7901
Reviews.Content: The only thing that turned me off was the resort fee I had to pay. When I booked the reservation online it did not state that there was an additional resort fee. Now I know and will be prepared next time. Otherwise my stay was awesome!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: vickysunshine
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay at the holiday inn this weekend, i stayed there from the 24th of September until the 26th of September, it was so much fun and the rooms were nice and clean. I spent both days by the pool and it was great except all those love bugs haha. It was also a very short drive to disney, all in all its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ndt_guy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and found it to be very good. There are a number of restaurants close by and there is more then enough parking. The rooms are clean and both times we stayed there we had a balcony room. The only issue we had is that we had a room on the 8th floor near the elevators. On the roof was where the motors that ran the elevators. They annoyed us for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Seay Family Blast”
Reviews.Author: Quinnletta
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed ourselves. We were there to celebrate our daughter's 13th bday on 9-17-10 and our 11th wedding anniversary. Everything was right there at hands reach, the hotel was very,very nice the staff was very professional. My husband and I plan on returning in a few weeks with more family,to experience what we experienced.. This hotel is very beautiful with great scenary for pictures. We'll be back you hear!!!!!! :+)

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly clean, great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot111
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at a humble Holiday Inn with full amenities, not pretentious but great breakfast staff, friendly front desk, clean rooms and just a pleasure to enjoy at a wonderful rate. The staff handled hoards of soccer kids and parents with the greatest of ease and thankfully, I was Not one of that crowd but observed how diplomatically the breakfast staff treated swarms of hungry people. The pool was clean as a whistle and front desk could not be more accomodating. I say humble because Holiday Inn's have been part of America's landscape for quite some time and yet, this particular one shines I believe due to proper management and happy personnel. Kudos to your efforts!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: quiziggy
Reviews.Content: I needed a room and fast. This one was available and in a great location and with one call I was there. Inside I found a restaurant with a hot meal and great service. Fast check in and check out. I look forward to the next stay.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel accommodations were excellent very clean and pleasant”
