Reviews.Author: nyne
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and comfortable the bed was excellent the food was tasty and temperature was good. the service for the rooms were good and the workers were very polite and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyVisitor4
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at another hotel near Disney for one day and erroneously chose this one. It looked fabulous in the pictures and in its descriptions online but it was nothing like that in real life. It said it had restaurants and eating on premises but when we went there for lunch, they weren't serving. The front desk said they serve all day but after the short trip down the hall to the restaurant, we met with the cook and he said, "no, no lunch today." We asked why and he just repeated himself even after we said the front desk and its ads say it serves lunch. Since we didn't have a car, we had to walk to McDonald's next door. We tried again for dinner and were told the same thing!!!!!! They were only serving pizza even though there were menus and other foods advertised. The cook told us to come back the next morning for breakfast because they'll be serving a breakfast buffet. We didn't want to have McDonald's again so we walked the main drag in the heat until we found a Beningan's. We did all of this with small children too! We took the kids downstairs to the game room and was exciting to see that they had a kid's movie room too! Well, the movie room had a flat screen TV on the wall playing regular TV and the game room had several broken games in there. So, both things were a bust! We sat at the pool which was okay but too hot to do with young kids all day long. We didn't have tickets to the Disney parks until the next day and I thought from the ads on the internet that our kids could have fun at this hotel for one day. I was completely wrong! The room was clean so that was a plus but we were so bored there! Plus having to walk to find a restaurant two times in one day was ridiculous. I'm embarrassed that I actually paid to stay there. Thankfully we went to a Disney resort hotel the next day which was FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A last minute selection turned into a great stay”
Reviews.Author: CTWaddell
Reviews.Content: The Main Gate East was a wonderful hotel. I was forced to find a room at midnight when another local hotel that I was staying in didn't meet my expectations. The staff was extremely helpful even at the late hour. It was very close to the local attractions and the pool and play area was great for my three year old. Thank you for saving my vacation. :)

Reviews.Title: “its true, the bathroom is so small you can't change your mind in it”
Reviews.Author: jagncc
Reviews.Content: it was dirty, small and cavelike, most of which they can't change. the air conditioning unit is next to the bed and must have a control that will only let it run for a couple of minutes because it keeps turning on and off all night long.... I couldn't sleep! The next day I ask the front desk, with the maintance guy standing there, to turn the fan on so the would run all the time. They were unable to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Room but Dirty”
Reviews.Author: maderpint
Reviews.Content: Had a Kids Suite, very good idea, room was nice and roomy, bathroom was small but ok, but the hygiene and cleanliness were minimal. We stayed 3 nights and the only thing they did was change the towels, they didn't even redo the bunk beds of the children. The room was well appointed, it had everything you need, the pool was nice and the restaurant as well. the only thing is the cleanliness, please IHG do something, it's a great product that can't be ruined by sloppy housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Visit"”
Reviews.Author: knote
Reviews.Content: Just a note to say what a wonderful stay I experienced at the Holiday Inn Maingate East in Kissimmee, Fl this twice this month. Istayed there on my way to visit family and on my return vist, as well. On each visit, the front desk staff was very courteous, provided a quick check in/check out process, and even provided me with a "welcome gift Bag"! The hot breakfast in the dining area was fresh, very tasty, and a great value for the money. With each stay, the rooms were clean, beds were fresh, and the A/C worked very well. The lobby area was beautifully decorated as the hotel was renovated as few years ago. I am looking forward to making this my preferred Holiday Inn for furture visits to Disney and other travels when in the area. Thanks Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: TomLinley
Reviews.Content: Great value, profession and attentive staff. The hotel is close to attractions and restaurants. A complete location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Suprise - Hooray Priceline Bid!”
Reviews.Author: weekendtripper2
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find an inexpensive hotel in Orlando that didn't have a billion bad reviews on the internet. I decided to bid $50 a night on Priceline, and this is what I got. We were unsure what we were in for until we arrived. We were very surprised (pleasantly so!). When we arrived, we were quite early and were still allowed to check in right away. One thing we noticed was lack of air conditioning in the lobby and hallways. It was 95 degrees outside, so that was rather uncomfortable. Once we got to our room, we were able to control the temp and made it nice and cool. Things were in fantastic condition. Things were clean, there was plenty of room to move around, and there was a nice space to set up our baby daughter's pack n play. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the pillows weren't too fluffy. We opened our window and found a nice balcony with a view of the pool. We actually delayed our plans 'til the next morning so we could enjoy the pool that evening. We ate Pizza Hut at the cafe in the lobby that also features an A&W root beer pub. It was very convenient, if a little pricey, but the pizza was very good. The cafe seemed a bit disorganized and they seemed to have no cups for the drink machines. It was also very hot because of the lack of air in the corridors. Otherwise, we were very pleased with the experience. I have one serious complaint. The housekeeper left an envelope next to the bed with a request for us to drop a tip for her at the front desk. I understand that housekeeping is hard work, and I would be more than happy to tip a housekeeper who went above and beyond for us. However, I don't enjoy the feeling that I'm being pressured into it. That being said, everything is very clean in this hotel, it seems very safe and they were even hosting a wedding reception while we were there. Very nice place to stay. Priceline really helped us out here. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Good value-booked from priceline”
Reviews.Author: zzz098
Reviews.Content: After I bid for a 3 star on priceline and I found my winning bid was Holiday Inn I was worried because I had stayed at a Holiday Inn in Cocoa Beach that was disgusting(dirty/old)/I was really pleasantly surprised.Nice clean and large rooms.Only problem was that the bathroom is dark and extremely tiny.You need to keep the door open due to claustrophobia. Don't book the kids rooms, they are cramped-better to go with 2 Queens. Great location.The free shuttle to Disney was very crowded, some had to stand for the 45 minute ride(with stops).I'd definitely stay again-really nice staff.Good breakfast-kids eat free.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled by website! Very dissappointing.”
Reviews.Author: LJP21
Reviews.Content: I spent a year planning this trip for our family of four and burst into tears at the sight of the hotel. The website photos are VERY misleading. The pool is small, the kid suites are small and dark, plus they do not tell you that the kid suites do not have a working balcony for "safety reasons". (Other hotels like Great Wolf Lodge work just fine). There was dust hanging out of the air conditioner in our room (which housekeeping turned off during the day while Orlando was having a heat wave). On a positive note, every person that works there is friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at GREAT Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: melecopj
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a positive comfortable experience. The room was very clean, something that matters to my wife, son and I. The ONLY issue was the sink that was slightly slow to drain. This didn't affect us in any way as it was still fully usable. Overall, we will choose this hotel again the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This plac is horrible, dirty and the manager lie to us”
Reviews.Author: Greenmerc77
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation thru priceline, and when we got to our room we got greeted with a old moldy smell. The walls were dirty with food crap on the walls and ceiling. The bed looked nasty and you could see the sweat stains on the pillows. The "white" sheets were dark brown with stains along with the bed skirt and curtains. We stayed there fr about 10 minutes and we left. I talk to the manager who offer me to change m to another room but the damage was done. He told me that I was not going to be chafed for anything but they charge me for a day for staying in a duty room for 10 minutes. These place was so bad that I could not eat my lunch in the room. I tried calling but the manager seems to be busy all te time, so I'm going there to try to get my money back. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: NaplesKayakCompany
Reviews.Content: Got finished pretty late and we were driving around while reading some scary reviews of area hotels and came across this hie like an oasis. I was going to priceline it but was too tired so I was pleasantly surprised that it was 89. The desk. Girl Tiffany was nice and hooked us up with the kids suite which has a queen, 2 twin bunk beds and 2 tvs! Impeccable room. If you have kids get this room! Chris Naples Kayak Company

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: puertohonky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Holiday Inn Main Gate East twice now. My wife and kids have had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “A good location and decent price”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three nights on business. Very busy hotel, mostly tourists, if not all. Room was nice, even had a small deck with slider, which was nice to have in the evenings. This would be a great place for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RonsB4U
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 2 year old and 18 year old Birthdays - and it was a great stay! It was my hubby, the 2 year old, 13 year old and 18 year old. The one downside, which was no fault of the hotel, we got our camera stolen at the Dennys a few doors down. But coming back to the hotel and being able to have the kids go to the gameroom, helped take their minds off of what happened. The hotel room was great! Bunk beds for the bigger kids sectioned off from the main bed area was FANTASTIC!!! The hotel is in a great location. Close to the I4 and right next to Celebration which is a beautiful city. The hotel staff was very accomodating and very courteous. Check in and out was easy and stress free and I would recommend the hotel to all my friends and family. GREAT RATES for a Kids Suite!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS NASTY AND UNSAFE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jaclark
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this hotel for our stay while we were visiting Disney. We checked into the hotel and found our room with dried puke on the bed skirting......... the bathroom smelled like mold and mildew from the nasty shower curtain and the carpet was nasty and turned my small childs feet black from walking on it! We did not stay in our room for more than a few minutes and we checked out of the hotel and the guy at the front desk assured me that I would not be charged for the stay. However I was charged for one day of the three days we booked and when I called back to the Hotel the next day and asked to speak with the manager she told me that the manager was unavailable to speak with me because she was busy with the police and one of the hotel guest. It has been two weeks and I have still not been refunded any money. I called Holiday Inn Corporate office and they told me they backed up their hotel management staff and would not refund my money or offer any assistance to me....... I will be disputing this with my credit card company and I will never stay at another Holiday Inn Hotel....... SO DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL OR YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: tylam
Reviews.Content: It was better than I expected. The hotel was very nice and the price was very reasonable. The staff was very nice and cordial, including the maids. I have no compaints and I would definitely return to this hotel. The hotel was in a convenient spot and well accessible to all sorts of restaurants and the Disney parks. This was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at a Holiday Inn again!”
Reviews.Author: Number61Mom
Reviews.Content: I waited a few days to write my review because I wanted to try to express my opinion while giving accurate examples. We are not "travel snobs" nor do we have any problems forgiving mistakes, they happen, but what seemed to be the norm here on our vacation was concerning. Of note after our stay, I do not believe one positive review written about this establishment--I truly believe they are written by somebody associated with Holiday Inn. Yes, I did book our accommodations through Priceline, however, I was reimbursed for a portion of our prepaid trip which is unheard of--that is something that never happens. My opinion of this establishment is based on the following: had to have maintenance come up and fix safe on the first day (wouldn't lock), our room went uncleaned an entire day (we were not on the property from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.), there was a turantula in our room (yes -- a huge spider of which I took pictures) which required two horrified men at 11:00 pm to kill, fire alarms going off during the night (yes, evacuations to tower one -- oddly enough, tower two never even knew), small over-crowed pool of which we never saw anybody tending to, bar/lounge that didn't open until 3:00 p.m. and, the killer one, we left the property for a day only to return and find our prepaid room had been rented out to somebody else who actually was kind enough to return some of our personal possessions--several items, however, mysteriously disappeared "it was a housekeeping error" was all we got from the manager. I felt really bad for the traveler who they rented our room to -- poor thing actually apologized to us. I remember Holiday Inn being known for setting a Standard for an acceptable travel experience-- yes, not a Hilton, Marriott or Hyatt, but we did not pay or expect that. It's unfortunate that I believed they would still have the same qualities they used to have. I would not have even expected all we experienced at a "fly-trap, no-tell, motel." I'm embarrassed to say I stayed at this hotel and would never, never recommend it to anybody else.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Stay Here! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: msojones
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at another hotel and upon our arrival discover that our original hotel was not what it was advertise to be. It was horrible! I drove around the next morning in search for another hotel to check my entire group into and found this hotel, Holiday Inn on Bronson Memorial Highway! Oh my goodness, this hotel and it's customer service experts were AWESOME! The front desk help of Maria and Melissa ( I renamed them the team of M & M) saved our trip and gave us customer service that our group found priceless. The hotel's location is in the middle of everything and if you dont want to drive you can take a shuttle everywhere, walk to many places to eat and shop and find so much in the hotel itself that you could enjoy your stay right in the hotel if you decided not to go out or just walk across the street! We enjoyed our stay so much, that I will be bringing my family back before the summer is out and there is no question where I will stay, it will be here, Holiday Inn 5711 W Irlo Bronson Highway Orlando Fl (Kissimmee) and I almost forgot! The price was right! Frankie (the manager) you are doing a GREAT JOB and M&M (Maria and Melissa) I can not say thank you enough for everything. Holiday Inn, these are your employees for the Month! Maria and Melissa! See ya soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Staff went over and beyond, My family loved it, Thank You”
Reviews.Author: dj83mj
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this place. They helped us, and the rate was good. Plan on going back next month. Can't wait, it was very comfortable and the serv ice was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good stay”
Reviews.Author: alex0kdt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days for a visiting DisneyLand. Pluses: good service, big and free outdoor parking, a lot of shops around, well priced Pizza Hut inside the building. Large and warm outdoor pool. Free shuttle from/to DisneyLand runs 2-3 days per day, but it also pick up people from other hotels and sometimes it was overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “It was good until...”
Reviews.Author: littlenaty14
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is not brand new but it has been redone and even though the rooms are a little tight it works and is nicely redone. The hotel staff was friendly and I was happy until I left my watch on the night stand and called a few times, was transfered to the cleaning staff where a recording came out and I was told to leave a message with the item and my information. To date I have not heard back from them. I did not expect to have the cleaning lady return my watch, as not many people are honest nowadays but the least they could have done was return the call and say they did not find the item. The item was not of much value but had great sentimental value, and it sucks to not even feel like someone tried to help you. Also the shuttle buses need improvement. Very unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect but just fine for us”
Reviews.Author: spookle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 21 nights. We were mean't to be in the comfort suites opposite but due to rebooking cos of the volcano we were placed here. It was by no means perfect but there as very little bad to say about it. Our midnight checkin was easy, the rooms fine for what we needed (bathroom a bit small), cleaned every day with new towels, comfy bed, pool adequate, location good. Next to McDonalds which is handy for brekkie and opposite Old Town which is great to walk over to. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised reviews were so positive”
Reviews.Author: albanydr
Reviews.Content: We booked this room after reading over the reviews that other trip advisor members had to how great their stay was. I was very disappointed! The room over all on first impression is what you would expect from a 2 -3 star hotel room. The bed was awful due to the massive ditch that you could see clearly even when it was made. The TV looked like something that my grandmother has in her house but it did work. On a comical note the TV was on the same circuit as the hallway light so if you turned off the hallway light the TV would turn off. Not a big deal since we didn't spend too much time in the room. The bathroom was a disaster! The vent fan was loud it sounded as if a plane was about to take off, we reported it however no one came until an hour before we checked out. We also noticed that there was mold GROWING out of the bottom of the sink ewww. If I noticed this earlier I would have stayed somewhere else. It also explained why my nose wouldn't stop running during our trip - I highly allergic!! The breakfast reminded me of a HS cafe if its free its good for coffee however DO NOT pay for it. There are so many breakfast options within a min. or two including a Dunkin Dounuts which was our destination of choice. Location wasn't bad at all although you have a cheesy theme park across the street and this is not the pretty part of Orlando. If you are staying at the Gaylord for a conference and need to save money might be worth looking into - it is close by if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Shout out to Carmelo in maintenance”
Reviews.Author: kcarriea
Reviews.Content: My 4 yr old daughter and I was staying on the third floor and was lost looking for the ice machince. Carmelo was so friendly he stopped what he was doing and walked us down to a machine then he walked us back to our room .I Felt very safe at this hotel and carmelo was very nice to help us..He could have just gave us directions but he took time and walked with us..The front desk was also great with fast check in and out..

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service needs work”
Reviews.Author: paulashannon
Reviews.Content: Everything with the hotel was great but not with the shuttle service to the parks. They were about 15 minutes late in the morning. We were told they'd come into the lobby and make an announcement when they arrived but they did not. I just happened to go outside and inquire, and sure enough it was our shuttle getting ready to leave. We were about 2 -3 minutes late getting to the bus when we left the park and it was gone. We received no helpful instructions as to where to get the bus and it was the very last one in the lot. Also, you have only one scheduled departure from the hotel and one from the park unless you want to take the monorail, which adds to the confusion and not knowing where to get the bus. So we could have paid the $14 parking fee instead of a $26 taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: KMRW
Reviews.Content: I consider Holiday Inn the most unreliable hotel chain; you really never know if it's going to be new and nice or run-down. The Holiday Inn Main Gate East was even better than I expected. The check-in was fast and the staff was extremely nice. We were travelling with a one-year old and were able to get a crib in our room for no charge. There is a great courtyard with a pool, huge children's pool, and a playground. I don't know when the rooms were last updated, but they feel new and the beds had a lot of pillows. Everything was very clean. The location is great, very close to Disney, Old Town, Publix, (grocery store) and a variety of restaurants. There is also a McDonalds next door, so we would often walk over to grab breakfast before heading over to Disney. We go to Disney every two years and don't want to spend a lot of money on our hotel. We were able to get a great deal on our room through the Holiday Inn website, and will definitely be staying here again. It was by far the nicest hotel we have found for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was awesome and had a geat stay.”
Reviews.Author: sstaz42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a location that anyone will enjoy due to the stores and entertainment area. Everything is within walking distance and the hotel itself has alot to offer. The view the rooms have is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Clean”
Reviews.Author: teenerbean
Reviews.Content: I had read that this hotel recently went through a remodel..and we believe it..the room was so clean and nice, it looked like we were the first to stay in the room. The sliding glass door that led to a balcony was safety locked(previous guest had requested it..kids staying room) so I called down to the front desk and the maintence person was there in a flash(really within 3 minutes)..he also was kind. Only a short ride to Disney..and across the street from Old Town..a little shopping, eating and a few rides. We had a nice stay..just too short.

Reviews.Title: “Stay whenever I am in the area”
Reviews.Author: lhouse21
Reviews.Content: We first stayed early March in a kids suite. The staff was wonderful and when turned my comment card in I had a message before I got home about a concern I had, They sent me a link for further stays for reservations and the managers name. We then stayed a few weeks later and had a double queen room and it was also great. Every time we saw any one they asked if we needed anything or i they could help.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, satisfying, and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: shirl369marmol
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The service was less than expected from a Holiday Inn. The locationn was near all and the free wi-fi was very useful. The hot breakfast buffet was OK, a little expensive though.What i least liked was the food at the brewakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “In one word "TINY"”
Reviews.Author: crangel4
Reviews.Content: I guess they have special rooms for people who go though companies like priceline. The bathroom is so tiny. If you are over weight at all, please reconsider. Even I could hardly put my arms down on my side when sitting on the comode. I am 5'3,and it wasn't even long or wide enough for me to extend my arms completely. The balcony (if you can call it a balcony) was around 2 feet wide,just enough to stand out on to. The AC was so loud. It would not stay on, so you had to keep the remote in your hand and keep turning volume on TV up and down as the AC cut off and on.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway at the Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbelle79
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews, I admit I was a bit wary about staying at this hotel. Luckily, I had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn. I stayed for 3 nights from March 5-8th for a weekend getaway to Disney World. This hotel was located very near to the main entrace to the Disney world resort. On several of the days we used the free shuttle and found it to be fairly convenient though the times are limited. One evening we wanted to leave the parks early and so took the Public bus LYNX #56 from the Magic Kingdom ($2). The public bus stopped directly across the street from the hotel at Old Towne which was super convenient! I found the room to be very clean and attractive. The beds were very comfortable (I had the best sleep I probably have ever had at any hotel). The room was well appointed and had two huge queen size beds. Each bed had a nice selection of pillows. The bathroom area was a little cramped, but it didnt bother me at all. I had no problem accessing the free wifi internet. The room provided a basic television which included HBO. The only thing which would have been nice was if the room had a fridge. Luckily it was a bit chilly that weekend so we kept the sodas on the balcony. :) Overall my stay was great and I would definitely stay here again the next time i find myself in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DPREEL
Reviews.Content: We are avid travelers and we found this hotel to be one of our best Holiday Inn experience. From the pleasant front desk to the attentive services, we felt at home. All this and great rates too.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Straight_Forward
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip alone and it eventually went very well at this solid 3 * hotel with an air/hotel package. Generally, I felt secure and any of my concerns were addressed. Most staff encountered appeared friendly and engaged. The front desk was always attentive and responsive, including follow-up to ensure satisfaction. In particular, “Maria” was a gem when I asked to be relocated due to two extremely late night hallway parties with back and forth door slamming by 4 rooms of unsupervised youth on my floor. The hotel is a buzz of activity and not particularly quiet or tranquil but most patrons are there for the Disney parks and crash by 10PM. Travel desk provided good information as to fair ticket prices. My first room was in tower 1 with a balcony and faced the rooftop air conditioners with side pool view. My 2nd room faced the front street with a Juliet balcony. I was informed much later that the patio doors should not be opened due to safety regulations. Signage would have been nice. Traffic street noise is prominent as well as the noisy room ventilation units. Yes, on the 8th floor it takes quite some time to get hot water. Observation: Disney = kids = sticky door knobs, TV remotes, elevator buttons and carpet stains. For families, a suite is well worth the money because not only is it larger in size but you have a small fridge & microwave. (Bring/buy kitchen utensils as none are provided) If you come across a Super Target in your travels, stock up as prices are significantly better than the nearest Publix. Car is definitely a necessity. Best things - the white, thick, fluffy towels, comfy bed and pillow options were a welcomed treat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the $$.”
Reviews.Author: Geaux_Fish
Reviews.Content: Dates of stay: Feb 20-26. My wife booked this hotel through Priceline for $35/night, and after reading some of the reviews here...well, I was scared. BUT, I was pleasantly surprised with the room and friendliness of the staff. Being a frequent Holiday Inn traveler, I have earned a good deal of points with the Intercontinental Hotel chain. A few days before our stay, I called the hotel and asked to speak to a manager. I gave him my ID number and asked if it would be possible to get an upgraded room or at least a room with a mini-fridge in it. After looking up my information, he informed me that he had changed my reservation and put us in a "Kids Suite." Upon arrival, we were quickly and politely checked in. The Kids Suite had a mini-fridge, bunkbeds for the little one, a seperate TV for the little one, and a nice and very comfortable queen size bed seperated from the bunk beds by a wall. The room was not extravagent, but it was nice for the 4 year old to have her own side of the room to play in and watch cartoons. Restaurant - Breakfast was OK. We had tickets for free continental (aka cold) breakfasts during our stay, and we could upgrade to the full hot breakfast for an extra $2.00 It was worth it. We didn't eat dinner there, but the little one had a hot dog and fries from there one night...fries were good! Resort Fee - Yes, they charge a resort fee of $5/day. Yes, I think it's a ripoff, but for what we paid for the room and the complimentary upgrade we got, I wasn't about to complain. Wireless internet was free. At least they stopped charging for that. Friendliness - We never encountered a grumpy/rude employee. I called one night to see if I could get a microwave in the room, and they had one delivered within an hour at no charge. Maybe this was because I'm a "Points Person" but who cares! Pool - The little one wanted to swim so we did use the pool and hot tub. Both were clean. The Negatives - Not a whole lot to complain about. Yes, it is an older hotel that has a nice exterior with so-so rooms. Our room was updated, but it did feel a little old. Our room faced the highway so traffic noise was a little noticeable, but the sound of the AC drowned out most of the noise. The bathroom was tiny (real small) but clean. They normally charge $10/day for mini-fridge and/or microwave rental. I dodged this fee b/c of my Points status. Overall, I would stay here again if I were given the upgraded room for free. You are conveniently located to the Disney Parks, and there is plenty of places to eat around the hotel. For $40/night, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: zoeboesmom
Reviews.Content: We paid $50 including tax on Priceline. First, there is a $4.95 resort fee. Not sure why, it's a Holiday Inn, but if the hotel was worth it I wouldn't have minded. Unfortunately, it wasn't. The staff was polite, neither particularly helpful or rude, the location is okay but be prepared to listen to road traffic and ambulances all night. The hotel is apparently close to a hospital. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows but only a very thin blanket on the bed. The vent from the heater was bocked by a curtain that could not be moved, so it shut off with the room freezing, but the spot between the curtain and window nice and toasty. The bathroom looked clean at first but the shower was filthy. Black mold growing in the corners on and spot on the way all curtain. It was gross. The worst part was the curtains however. The room has sheer white curtains that close and heavier striped ones that are purely decorative and do not close. And yes, you could see through them. I could see the lady in the next tower laying on her bed in her robe. To make it worse, there is a balcony light that shines into the room and since you can't close the curtains, your room is flooded in bright light all night long. I was up every hour thinking it was morning and the sun was shining in.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: CJR07
Reviews.Content: WOW! Our first stay, and are we hooked. As Annual Passholders for years, we have stayed at many of the hotels in the area, including some of the Disney hotels. The Holiday Inn Main Gate far exceeded our expectations. The rooms, including bathrooms were spacious and newly decorated. The staff very friendly and helpful, always with a smile. The food court was clean and the food very fresh. We truly enjoyed our stay and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “You can count on a great stay here every time.”
Reviews.Author: statesmen23
Reviews.Content: I have been to this property several times and each stay has been great! The staff is very attentive to detail and you can tell that they genuinely appreciate the opportunity to serve each guest like they are special. The rooms have been updated and you can count on all of the comforts of home. Theme parks and food are close by. What else do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: First stayed here in Sept 2008 and chose it again last year at the same time. Very quiet in September, which makes it an ideal place to relax and is why we decided to stay here again for a few days. The rooms are very clean and the facilities are good, which we have come to expect from Holiday Inn. Good restaurant, reasonably priced and friendly service. The hotel is located within a short walking distance of The Old Town attraction and to an array of fast food joints, restaurants and shops. However, like most places that can be found along the 192, there is little else in the form of nightlife and entertainment. With a car, however, it is only a short drive to the Disney parks. Within the hotel complex, there are two good-sized pools, one for adults and one for kiddies. However, due to bad planning, the adult pool sees very little sun during the daylight hours because it is in almost constant shade. Therefore, the water in that pool does tend to be a bit on the chilly side most of the time. Other than that, a fairly decent hotel. Ideal for families.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: johnsonk6
Reviews.Content: Very nice for the couple of days we were there. Got it on priceline and it was anice place. Location and quality of room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accomodations, great price”
Reviews.Author: willisg71
Reviews.Content: This was a very cheap hotel right in the middle of the Celebration/Kissimmee area, easily accessible to all of the area parks and attractions. Overall, an average hotel, but the price we got on Hotels.com made it a great overall experience for us where we had that much more to spend on amusement. The hotel experience would have been better for me if their wireless internet access worked in the room. We stayed a week and it still hadn't been fixed by the time we left. You had to go down to the main lobby to access the internet, an inconvenience to people who have to do a little work on vacation. Great place for leisure travellers, not so much for business travellers until that is addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: wasu1020
Reviews.Content: We found the beds to be very comfortable and the rooms clean. The staff was excellent and provided the refrigerator we needed for medication within a very short period of time. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. ST

Reviews.Title: “Not 3 stars but OK for a Family”
Reviews.Author: ericdetwiler
Reviews.Content: I checked in on a Monday for a business trip and check in was smooth. My room was right over the kitchen of the pizza hut and the fan was right outside my balcony. This hotel is not the cleanest as I witnessed in my bathroom. Mold was on the ceiling and on the back of the door. Not a good start. I tried to clean it off but was unable too. The room itself was pretty clean and comfortable but the courtyard was usually noisy from kids playing in the pool. So if you need quiet to sleep then this hotel might not be for you. I got this room on priceline and I would not price this in a 3 star category. I got a great rate for a mediocre hotel. A family on a budget would like this hotel for the location but business travelers will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: chrisncraz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in December 2009 to attend the Emmy's Dinner at the Gaylord Palms Hotel right around the corner. Why not stay at the Gaylord Palms? $250+ a night! But saying that--- the Gaylord Palms is a beautiful hotel that is more like an indoor recreational center with shopping, restaurants, exhibits, and different Florida themes. It is a must see. Go to their tripadvisor page and look at the pictures. You will not be disappointed. Regardless... I needed to stay somewhere less expensive. And this hotel had great reviews, was well priced, near the Gaylord Palms, and was chain hotel that I like--Holiday Inn. Overall, I paid $68 a night with an advanced rate and AAA discount. Not bad. If you are driving up, they also have discount coupons in the roomsaver hotel books at reststops. I was quickly checked in and skipped the coupon desk because I wasn't going to Disney land nor did I want to be sold a timeshare as discussed by other travelers. There was plenty of free parking that had good lighting at night. The room was very clean and had a nice sliding glass balcony with decent views. The room was very clean. The beds were super comfortable and you had choices of hard/soft pillows. It was a great night sleep. You could tell the hotel and the rooms had been renovated. Well done. I'm picky and enjoyed it immensely. The room had old boob tubes TVs...which I'm sure will get replaced soon. The bathroom was clean but looked a bit dark and dull. It needed better lighting and some more cheerful color. But most importantly it was clean and had nice towels. I used the hot tub which was clean and proper temperature. Plenty of towels surrounding the pool as well. My only disappointment was how many take out menus were on the floor inside the room. I don't know if the hotel allows this or not? But either way... it needs to stop. I understand Orlando is filled with families looking for cheap eats. But to walk into a room with five or six menus slipped under the door isn't great. When we returned that night there were more. Also, hallways could use more attention with left out pizza boxes and food items. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, very pleasant with great value.”
Reviews.Author: magtimes2
Reviews.Content: We were there to go to amusement parks. We had a very clean, comfortable room, very courteous staff, and great amenities. It was an outstanding value and was even better than we were expecting. They even called the room an hour after we checked in to see if everything was acceptable. The only negative (not about the hotel itself,) was the time share seller booth in the lobby. We went over for discount coupons, ended up seeing the presentation for cheaper Disney tickets and they made us stay way past the 90 minutes using blatant lies to sell us their time share.Just a warning. The hotel was wonderful and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, Terrible treatment”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBarbara
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the night manager had lost our reservation, and then made us wait for one hour while he found it. We had to get our computer out of our car in the pouring rain and find our reservation confirmation from the hotel. When we arrived in our room, the tub was disgusting it was filled with black hair, the toilet seat was broken, the fan in the bathroom was broken and the bathroom floor was filthy, as well as, the carpets were not even vaccumed. We also had medication with us and requested a fridge. It was plugged in for us and in the morning, thank god we woke up early, there was water all over the floor and our medication was now at room temperature. We called the manger on duty and they apologized and sent someone up to clean up the room and replace the fridge. When we had booked the room we were told they were pet friendly. The next morning we were contacted and were told to pay 150.00 for a steam clean for the room for the dogs when we checked out. I asked why we were not told this in advance. I then called the afternoon manager and she apologized, she said they would waive the fee, but told us that the next time they would not accept our dogs. I thanked them and hung up. Later that afternoon the night manager called and told me that I needed to take my dogs to a kennel and he had contacted one for me to take my dogs to. I told him no, that is why I brought them with me to avoid a kennel. He then told me to leave the hotel immediately. I then went to the front desk with my husband and told us we were treated horribly and terribly inconvenienced. He confronted us rudly and told us to get out of his hotel now. We refused and he then called the police. The police arrived and after speaking with them calmly we were told to write a letter to head office which we are doing. Our opinion is, if you are an animal lover and dont want to sleep in filth, find another hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Totally unacceptable experience”
Reviews.Author: maryann044
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible experience. We used priceline and the price was immediately accepted that we put in. Reason? It was more than this hotel was advertising for. That alone is a bad reflection on both Holiday Inn and Priceline. I sent a note to Priceline complaining that they double charged the "fees." Priceline collected them and the Hotel charged for them on check out. Priceline said the Holiday Inn would not refund the money for the difference in what I paid for the room and what they were charging OR the extra fees and as for cleanliness... NOT SURE what hotel the previous rater went to - but we had hair all over our shower, it leaked everywhere as well, the balcony lock did not work, there were bugs in the room and the person behind the front desk was not able to help with any complaints because they needed a "manager." I saw ONE person cleaning the entire hotel. The bathrooms are smaller than closets. SERIOUSLY - my 8 year old could not even get dressed in the bathroom without banging the wall. They claim this was a multi-million dollar expansion. NO WAY. Everything was retro-fitted (hence, the bathroom leakage issue) and although the pool area was a plus, the rooms were so horrible - this hotel rates as 1-2 stars max. We stayed elsewhere for the remainder of our trip. Totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and quiet with a variety of amenities”
Reviews.Author: LKateP
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Main Gate East is a comfortable and quiet hotel, with a top service staff in an amazing location in the heart of the Orlando/Kissimmee tourist area. This hotel provides a variety of amenities for the individual traveler, families and business people including conference facilities, pool and fitness center, free (very) high-speed internet & a variety of food options on site as well as nearby. A few inconveniences were taken care of quickly by a friendly and helpful staff. For a more in-depth review of my stay please go to the attached link. http://www.examiner.com/x-5514-Orlando-Florida-Vacation-Examiner~y2010m1d5-Holiday-Inn-Main-Gate-East-In-the-heart-of-Orlandos-best

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be Decieving”
Reviews.Author: Yahya11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite with the bunk beds for the kids. The room appeared to be very clean, new and very welcoming. That was the case until I layed down. The mattress was too soft... no support on my back. I woke up with a lot of back pains.... that carried over throughout the day at the theme parks... The pics online appear to be more roomier than it really is. I didn't like the fact that the top bunk had a good visual of our bed. I wish they had sealed off the wall to give us some privacy from the kids... :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- would recommend”
Reviews.Author: tablefor5NC
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, comfy beds, nice choices between firm and soft pillows. Had connecting rooms, king for parents and 2 doubles for children. King room had nice "kitchen area" with large refridgerator and microwave. Rooms were spacious but the bathrooms were small, not much room between door and toilet. Great hotel for families with younger children or teenagers. Rooms also available with bunk beds.

Reviews.Title: “All good!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredRichP
Reviews.Content: Nice room. They have everything you could ask for in a for a good price. Lots of stuff to do all around the location. Visited all the parks, but ate most meals around the motel to save money.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL - GREAT ROOMS - GREAT PRICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RICHKEL123
Reviews.Content: we stayed there just last week & the experience was wonderful! This is a great hotel, rooms are large & roomy! We were on the 8th floor with balcony over looking pool area. Our room was very clean & showers were hot! Cant wait to go back! Great location - directly across the street from Old Town on 192 & just a minute from Disney! Nice pool, hot tub, & childrens pool with play area. Nice fitness room too. Great lounge & wonderful bartender.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor with comfy beds!!!!”
Reviews.Author: steveforrester5
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay. I thought it was a great price for such a modern looking hotel with lovely landscaping. All staff was very friendly especially at the buffet and pizza hut. The beds were comfy; loved the bed covers and the pillows. The bathroom was a bit small, but all in all we loved our room!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: mruizarias
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Very clean, the rooms have a great size, bed ..excelent. We traveled to Kissimmee for our honey moon (that was our first destination) and we had a great time at the hotel. The provided van service to the parks at Disney (at no cost). The location is ok, but it is good to rent a car in case you want to go out to dinner at night. The staff was great. You have an ALAMO (car rental) office INSIDE the hotel! and a Disney's parks tickets office also. So no need to move to buy the tickets or to rent a car. The only "not so good" thing I found is that you have to pay to get internet access.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING, STAY AWAY, NOT A GOOD HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: Neildale4
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 6PM to be told one of our rooms was not ready?!? (after a long flight from the UK and given the time of day,this was not a good start) The room that was ready was of a poor standard. The air con was very loud, there was a damp musty smell and when i sat on the bed a hair band full of hair and a TV remote control could be seen down between the headboard and the mattress, The floor was dirty and the whole place was at best "Shabby" When i Complained at the front desk we were given two family suites which were better than the first room but not much better than a ''no frills'' motel, but to be honest, A motel room would be Cleaner! We have been here over a week and our rooms have not been vacuumed yet! it's our second week and on each saturday we have been here they have had a 'STUDENT EXTREME' pool party with a very loud sound system and the pool area is jumping with lots of students having a good time, but if you want to relax and soak up a few rays or have a dip in the pool FORGET IT! When i spoke to the hotel about the "party's'' they showed no interest and said we could still go in the pool area (like you would!) i have stayed in Kissimmee around 11 times (i'm lucky) But this is the first time i have ever had a complaint. i have had better rooms and service in 2 star motels than in the holiday inn. The room was booked through Virgin Holidays who i will be contacting on my return and i'm also a holiday inn gold card holder so i'll contact them also. Do yourselves a favour and STAY AWAY !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: roddysUk
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I first arrived we were not happy with our room but the girl on reception was very helpful and eventually we settled on a room overlooking the pool. The bed was very comfortable but the room was not great, I would say it needed a proper clean with the bed and furniture being pulled out as you could see where the vacuum cleaner stopped. Some rooms have fridges or you can hire one for $5 a night, but it has to sit on the carpet which I don't think is very hygenic. The resort fee (all the hotels seem to be jumping on the bandwagon) was rediculous $4.95 plus tax a night, what a rip off, for what? There was nothing in this hotel that I would not expect in accommodation of that price. Another thing which I did not agree with was the amount of flyers that came through our room door every day from 2 pitzza places and they were strewn up the corridors as well. Why does the hotel allow this to happen ,they know it goes on? The location was excellent for the parks, no more than 15 mins away. The next time we come to Kissimmee I'd rather pay more for a better hotel as we love this area. We also love the Golden Corrall for breakfast and I would recommend. Lastly, don't be embarrased to cut out and use the coupons from all the magazines that you can pick up anywhere, all the establishments expect people to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: UkJetsetter
Reviews.Content: my partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. we found the staff to be very helpful, polite and friendly. the room service was very reasonably priced and a very quick service. the pizza hut and a&m were also very well priced. we didnt try the breakfasts at the hotel as myself n hubby arnt morning eaters but from the passing comments we herd it general consensious was that it was quite nice. the pool are and bar were well maintained and clean and the outdoor jacuzzi was also to the same standard. the rooms were more than adaquate with 2 double beds, t.v, table, iorn, iorningboard bathroom with lots of towels and balcony with seating. the rooms were cleaned everyday and the cleaning staff always a good morning or a hello for us. all in all we were only in the hotel for a couple of hours each day (appart from sleeping on a night ofcourse) and we found it to more than enough for what we needed. oh before i forget they have washing macheines and tumble dryers located on the 3rd n 6th floors which were really easy to use and very quick to wash and dry your clothes too (had to use them when i spilt a glass of red wind down my fave white t-shirt and jeans, take lots of quarters cos you need them for the macheines and to get the washing powder).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel over rated”
Reviews.Author: roddysUk
Reviews.Content: We had a few problems which we had fixed on the first night we arrived because I do not take any nonsense . After that, the egyption Manager refused to speak to me, how unprofessional is that ? In the bar two of the bar maids Milly and Jannet were great but the other one, I don't even know her name and don't want to, she was very ignorant . She put the bar lights down and sat in the corner on her laptop . One evening at 11 o'clock she just turned the t.v.and lights off completely when myself, my wife and another couple with two children were sitting there! The maid service was not great. A few times when we got back from our day out the we had to phone to have our room made up.

Reviews.Title: “Check everything before booking here.”
Reviews.Author: ladybug12329
Reviews.Content: Checking in at this hotel went well for my son and grandaughter, they arrived earlyer than I did. I was VERY disapointed with the "kids eat free " the only way they eat free is if the adult that is with them MUST buy their meal from a speical menu, which the prices are much higher than the other menus in the cafe. My grandaughter ordered mac and chesse, and the food was from a box like kraft mac and cheese. No effort for a nurishing,healthy meal there, she received a ice cream as part of the meal and as we opened it stuck to her fingers and fell apart in her hands, it was very old and freezer burnt. I threw it away. Needless to say we did'nt eat at all in the hotel we found other cheaper meals right next door and food delivery places were good. Our rooms were OK, although the plaster was craking and falling off the walls in bathroom, stains on the rug through out the room and you heard the humming of the elevator next door all the time. The pool area was nice, plenty of places to sit and enjoy the sun and large heated pool to swim in along with a kids pool and a small play area. Free transportaion to Disney, but you are expected to give tips to the driver over and back to hotel for each person in your group.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoloresD
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old grandson and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Maingate East from July 31 - Aug 4, 2009. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a kid's suite that consisted of a Queen size bed, table and chairs plus bunk bed seperated by a partition with it's own TV. This room also had a refridgerator. Room was nicely decorated and clean. The bathroom was extrremely small with sink out in the main area. I did not utilize the pool or the playground area but it looked extremely nice and welcoming. I had a breakfast at the buffet and it was tasty. Hotel offered easy access to Disney World, we did not use the hotel transportation but opted for the public bus which was right up the block and cost only $2. There were several places to eat within walking distance. There was a Walgreens and a Publix supermarket within a 5-minute walk. Staff was pleasant and friendly. I did have an incident at the hotel that was not rectified to my satisfaction. Upon returning to our room my grandson realized that someone had eaten his snack cake and left 1/2 of it behind and also helped themselves to 1/2 a bottle of water. I reported this to the General Manager and Housekeeping Director, unfortunately I do no feel that they took my concerns very seriously as I received one voice mail message from them that they were not able to speak to the housekeeper that cleaned my room as she was off duty that day. After that message there was no other updates. I also wrote to Guest Relations at Holiday Inn website with no response. Despite the above incident I did enjoy my stay at the hotel and would recommend it to a friend. I just hope that the hotel followed up on my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool but a few dissapointments!”
Reviews.Author: Pshalah
Reviews.Content: We pricelined and got this hotel but were very upset when we checked in and were told there would be an additional $4.50 per night resort fee! There was nothing at all that made it a resort - no ice machine on our floor, charged to use their computer in the computer room, no spa, and they raise your hopes when they send you after check in across the lobby for your welcome kit which is only a ploy to get you to check out a timeshare and buy tickets for Disney - very misleading!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable,clean and central”
Reviews.Author: gw74
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 weeks last year. newly refurbished by holiday inn. rooms were very clean and pleanty towels daily. pool are was nice and the kids enjoyed it, hot tub was boiling though so be careful. Kissimmee was brill, first time here as normally stay on international drive. Car rally at the weekend is great. plenty of restaurants surround the hotel, mcdonalds next door. close to all the disney parks and about 20 mins from seaworld ar universal. friendly staff. Watch out for the guest services offering you free tickets to shows. they tell you you dont have to go to timeshare but just visit a nearby hotel. We went and it is timeshare. just be forceful and tell them you're not interested. Worth an hour if you have it for discounted or free tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: ilovedanielle
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was the kid suite. It was great because it gave all of us our privacy. The beds was so confortable. and the room and bathroom were immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl808
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since we got a great rate thru their website. It was advertised as the “entertainment card” rate for the average price of $50 a night. There was also a resort fee of about $6 a day. We stayed there for 6 nights. Location (A): The hotel was in a very good location…10 minutes from all the Disney parks and it was very simple to get around. There was also a lot of restaurants and shopping on the 192 highway. Room (C-): We had the “family suite” which included a queen bed and bunk beds with a partition wall between them. The room was tiny and so was the bathroom. I don’t know how they managed to fit all the beds, 2 tv stands, a dresser, and a table with 2 chairs in that tiny space. The room had a mini-fridge, individual coffee maker, iron and ironing board. The door to the room was so flimsy, you had to slam it to close it. It had an a/c window unit that was very loud and made one side of the room cold, while the other side would take longer to cool. The only upside to the room was the décor which looked like it was recently updated, but it wasn’t as clean as we’re used to. There was mildew in the bathtub. Amenities (B): It had a lot of amenities: 2 restaurants (a pizza and burger place), a small gift shop, arcarde, a small kids theater, heated adult and children pools, Jacuzzi, gym, self-serve laundry facilities, and free parking. The elevators were slow. Overall (B): For the rate we paid, I would rate the hotel as a B. If we had to pay the regular rate of $90 plus a night, then I would definitely research other options.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but why is there a resort charge ???????”
Reviews.Author: KentishTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite surprising. Initlally we were offered a room overlooking the pool on the second floor which we declined. We were then offered an upgrade to the front of the hotel overlooking highway 192. This room was pretty good but....... it has bunks seperated from the double bed by a partition. This really meant that the bunk beds get little benefit from the air con, and they are quite claustrophobic. The room could have been arranged much better. We were on the 9th floor and we had a good view of Old Town, as I say it was better than we expected. What really annoyed us here though was the "resort charge" This is the first time I have been expected to pay for a gift shop which is one of the things the "resort charge" covers... Err why ????????? We were supposed to have a paper delivered daily, didnt happen and when we told the desk staff on checkout they managed to give lack of interest a new meaning. They could not have cared less. Resort charge is another name for how can we get a few more dollars out of visitors. Highway 192 is the Irlo Bronson memorial highway. Old Irlo would be horrified if he could see it..............Just about the worst road I ve ever seen. It makes Internation Drive look elegant . There really are no words to adequately describe it!!!!!!! The hotel is about 4 miles from disney and they do offer a "complementary shuttle" which you pay for in the "resort charge" so how can it be complementary I ask myself ????. We drove to Disney every day, it only took about 10 minutes but we were somewhat miffed at $12 per day parking there, especially given the costs of their tickets.... We didnt eat in the hotel, there are many restaurants nearby but one to avoid at all costs is one called ""Pacinos"" I will be commenting on this under a separate heading. There is a new sport here, compulsive door slamming, Why are so many people incapabole of shutting a door reasonably quietly ?? On the whole though this is an acceptable place to stay, and better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Good time, Good location, good pool, good service”
Reviews.Author: Beausdad
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the room with the separator and the bunk beds. Nice little fridge for keeping things cool - not real cold - just cool. Customer Service was very nice. Play room, tv room and arcade for kids. Across street from shopping area and next door to long strip center for inexpensive souvenirs. Playground for kids was excellent. Swimming pool was heated and wonderful. Food court in hotel w/ sporadic hours. Hotel gym was small. Rooms were clean, but carpets need cleaning. Shower/tiolet room was small. Would be nice to open windows. Location it took no more than 15 minutes to get to any park from here at any time. I definitely recommend fro the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service in good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY_fun_lover
Reviews.Content: I have booked through priceline and I had nightmare when I landed there in Holiday inn in midnight. The receptionist told us she does not have rooms to provide us, which I have booked 2 months ahead. I am not sure how they can allocate the rooms for what I have pre-paid already. Then I requested her to provide accomodation in other Holiday inn in nearby location, but she refused that and said she could only give in Best western. The facility provided there was horrible and next day we cheched in Holiday Inn. Apart from this mess they made, the hotel rooms and accomodation was excellent. So I would recommend you guys to call them a day ahead and inform your arrival time and to check the availability of room. This was the big lesson I learnt from this trip.

Reviews.Title: “All around excellent hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: dumppy
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was very comfortable and clean. The services were excellent. All personel were very cordial. Buffet was very good, had excellent food. Room temperature was very comfortable which is usually hard to find. Parking was adequate. All in all our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: LancsHomeboy
Reviews.Content: stayed on the 22 june, on check inn was told that my reservation had been cancelled! but told not to worry as they could find a room, they did 2nd floor overlooking the roof and air con fans!! don't get me wrong the actual room was good but no balcony for 4 nights the sound of all the aircon etc .we rang reception and were moved right away, The second foom was fine, nice big bathroom, etc, if you are planning to spend most of your time at the parks he accomadation is good. would I stay again Yes

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay for the Family”
Reviews.Author: pareewer
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great stay with the hotel. The staff was very courteous and the amenities were perfect. I especially loved the fun beds for the kids. It was a real treat for them.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Place”
Reviews.Author: CHARRAH
Reviews.Content: We are very particular about the hotels we stay in, so I have to admit that I was very nervous about staying here after reading the reviews. But, it was only for an overnight Disney trip so I figured we could tolerate it. The hotel is in a really nice location- one exit from Animal Kingdom and those areas, and only a few exits from the other Disney Parks and attractions. There are a ton of restaurants near by, including a Mc Donalds right next door. The hotel also has a couple of restaurants (Pizza and something else) in it, but we didn't try them out. The lobby was very clean and nice, and the hotel appeared to be very clean and looked a lot nicer inside than some I have seen. There's an arcade for children, and also a "childrens theatre" where they have emptied out a room and put a bunch of kid sized chairs in there (with a few adults ones too), and they have a big flat screen mounted to the wall that was playing Nickelodeon when we looked in there. It was a really cute concept! There's a Disney ticket counter, and a gift shop (I think it was a $10minimum purchase) My only complaint about the lobby is that there is a man standing who at first appeared to be working for the hotel. He had a portable small device in his hand, and asked if we were checking in, so we thought that maybe he had a device to help with wait lines and offer a faster check in (not a bad idea), but he was not. He asked my husband a couple of questions and wanted his email address, claiming it was for a satisfaction survey, but that the emails would come from "marketing research". So we declined on that. We were not approached directly about time shares, and since we FL residents, we didn't try to buy Disney tickets there either, just got them at the park. The pool and playground area looked really nice, we didn't have time to try it out. The hotel is also a ton bigger inside than it appears from the outside. There are two towers. Our room was in the first set of towers, facing the main road. We didn't hear any traffic noise, other than set of several fire trucks really late at night- nothing that any hotel window could have drown out. Didn't hear any traffic noise or anything like that. There's also an amusement type park right across the street, they had ferris wheels, bungee jump, skycoaster, etc. Again, a short trip for us and we didn't try that out either. The rooms-- I must say I was pleasantly suprised when we got into our room. It was tastefully decorated and had granite countertops and everything. The bed was comfortable, which is sometimes another issue for me since I sleep on a tempurpedic at home. My husband got us a family room which had bunk beds for the kids- not a good idea for us because our 2 year old was all over them. The top bunk is not "sealed off", so he could have climbed over the wall at the top and flipped into the floor on the other side where our bed was. I think this could be a design flaw, just because a kid of any age could have fallen over the top. We definitely kept him off of the top though. The bunk beds were a nice sturdy set, and the ladder was anchored into it so that we didn't have to worry about it falling. I think in general, the rooms are a great size, but the rooms with the bunk beds do feel like pretty close quarters. I would never try to fit more than 4 people in a room like that, and I think for any extended period of time it could start to feel really cramped. Next time we will most likely opt for the regular room, but that's just because we couldn't keep our 2 yr old off of the ladder. The bathrooms are a different story- it takes quite a bit of manipulation to get in there and shut the door, the door barely skims past the toilet as it closes. Not a big issue, because hopefully no one spends too much time in there, but for larger people it may be an actual problem-- it is a very tight fit. We didn't have any issues with parking when we returned about 10pm, not sure if it would be an issue in the busy tourist months of summer. There was also a rental car place on site. Overall I have no complaints about this hotel. We did come home and notice a $25.00 charge to our debit card from them, even though we used Holiday Inn points and got the room for free. We had no clue what the charge was- and still don't- but my husband called them and they took it off that evening. I would definitely stay here again given our first experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: tut727
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate on this hotel thru hotwire (although this hotel charges a $4.50 resort fee which was never stated by hotwire). My family and I go over to Orlando a lot since we are Disney Passholders. For this trip, it was a quick in and out. We arrived at the hotel Friday evening, and checked out very early Saturday morning. You can tell this is an older hotel that has been remodeled over the years. The room decor was nice and the room was clean. The down sides where the AC unit was very loud and ran all night (the noise never stops). Also the entry door to the room has a large gap under it, that allows a lot of light to come in. The hotel has a pool and hot tub area. We did not use these but could see them from our hotel window. They are just your average pool area, nothing exciting. The location was close to Disney, off 192, right across the street from Old Town. There are many restaurants close by. You would want to have a car if you are staying here has your vacation hotel. My wife read the schedule for the Disney shuttle, and it is not great(two drop off and pick up times). There is a fee if you want to go to Universal or Sea World. Overall this hotel meet our needs for this trip. If I was doing an extented vacation stay, I would look else where. If you get a cheap rate, it is not a bad place to stay. If you are going to hit the theme parks hard, and just need a place to rest for a few hours at night, than this hotel will fit your needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday location”
Reviews.Author: entdoctor
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for family and friends on a vacation........trip to theme parks........universal studio and disney is recommended

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: 12abcd
Reviews.Content: Well right from the very beginning the clerk at the desk got our reservations wrong. We had booked three nights and the first morning we were there we were given a checkout notice for 12:00 pm. Well when we went to the desk they had us staying only one night. Then the manager informs us to remember our parking permit and my husband told him we had not received one. Again another blunder. I knew she seemed a little ditzy but oh boy!!!! We were asked to go to the welcome center when we finished at the front desk and were given a line about 3 for the price of one at Pirates Dinner theatre. Well no one informed us we would have to sit thruogh a 90 minute timeshare program. We weren't interested and were given our money back. The room itself was just barely okay. As we weren't in the room it wasn't that bad but the hallway carpets looked as if they hadn't been vaccumed in days, same with the elevators. the place looked dingy and dirty. The carpet in our rooms looked as if they needed to be replaced three years ago. When I called the desk to request something they always seemed to get it wrong. I will not stay here again as I don't want to be troubled when I'm trying to enjoy myself. We just didn't like it at all. I was very disappointed as I had heard this was a good hotel. It was smelly and dirty in the halls and it was hotter than hot in the halls also. The man in the hotel store was on the phone when I went in to get batteries. When I asked for the batteries he acted as if I was interrupting him. No good. After all our trouble we weren't even offered a free breakfast. Nothing. Never again will they take my money and pooh on my.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay--probably will go elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: dawgfan35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Maingate East for a pre- Disney Spring Break Overnight stay. I booked a kids suite. The check in process was fairly smooth. The desk staff seemed to be very helpful or at least the girl I dealt with at check in was. This level of service was hit or miss later. The hotel, while billed as a Holiday Inn, is actually not a Holiday Inn owned property. It is leased for rights to be a Holiday Inn. This was on a sign in the lobby (small sign). Still no big deal. The place was packed. It was a busy week, so the staff was taxed to some degree. The hotel has good facilities. We only stayed one night so I cannot say much about the hotel as a whole. We did not use the pool. We did not eat at the restaurant. We did not use the bar. We did look at these areas. The lobby also has an area that seems to sell Disney stuff...tickets etc. Here is my take on the hotel facility. We got on the elevator after check in. The elevators are old and seemingly in need of service. They are slow and make a great deal of noise while riding in them. You know the type. Everyone in the elevator looks at each other with a sort of shocked and "uh oh" look on their face. The hallway on our floor looked as if the carpet had been laid about 10 years ago. Since that time many things had spilled or been ground into it. It was in bad need of replacement. The room was clean and adequate. It was big enough for us and comfortable. The kids suite was basically no more than a bunk bed with a partition wall. It was not enclosed in any way and opened to the bathroom. The kids had their own TV. The "bedroom" for us adults was a queen bed and TV of our own more toward the window in the room. The bathroom was fairly clean but not as clean as I would have liked. The room was also fairly clean. We needed more towels than were provided as they had not left enough for four people in the room. We called the front desk and asked for more towels. They never arrived. We called several times. We were told a few times that we would be sent towels. At one point we were told that they were out of towels and we could not get any!!! This aggravated my wife so badly that she called the front desk and insisted that we get more towels or we needed to move to another hotel. The desk finally agreed to get us more towels if we came downstairs to get them. I went down to the desk as requested and advised that my wife had been told that we could get more towels there. I was then told that they did not have any more towels and they would try to get them to us later...about an hour later. It was nearly 9:30pm at this point. I simply decided not to shower that night and grab a shower in the morning if we had towels. Of course we had better have them at that point!!. A maid arrived at our door just 10 minutes after my return to the room with a few towels in her arms. She advised that she had just been told of our request and that she had plenty of towels. She could not understand why the desk had told us what they had told us. The overall experience was okay at best. I would not stay here again. I know of better places to stay that afford better service and have better, cleaner rooms. The location was not bad. It is close to many things. There are many more places with better location in this price range. If I had known that the hotel was not owed by Holiday Inn but leased under the name, I probably would not have booked here.

Reviews.Title: “Will try somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: jayne21Lancashire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for many years the last time was 2 years ago and then it was perfect. My recent stay wasnt as enjoyable, we had emailed the hotel prior to our stay to ask if we could have rooms facing the pool and low floors with a balcony as we were travelling with 5 young children in our party. We recieved confirmation of this before we left the UK. On arriving we were allocated 3 rooms on the first floor but no balconys and they faced a flat roof, we were then moved to the 6th floor and told they didnt have any rooms on a lower floor, so two weeks were spent with kids trapped in doors when we were in the room as the youngest was 19 mths old and could fit through the balcony railings. Our rooms were cleaned daily but certainly not to an high standard, we could write our name in the dust under the table and across the wooden headboards. I had to ask for toilet roll twice and the tissue box didnt get replaced on the last 3 days although i asked twice, i also had to find the maid on our floor 3 times to ask for coffee as she never left any and when i did find her she was busy chatting on her mobile sat on a bed in another room. The bedding (valance) on the bed next to the air con was mouldy and this never got replaced in the 2 weeks we stayed. Also we booked our holiday with a travel agent in the UK but the hotel still charged us £56 service charge whilst we were there and when we asked what that was for they said it covered the cost of the hotels facilities re: the pool, internet etc, total rip off when we had paid a full amount to our travel agent, and whilst there i needed to check my emails and they charged me $5 for access to the net. Most of the reception staff were helpful and polite apart from the blonde curly haired young lady who never smiles and needs to go on a customer service course. We have always stayed at this hotel for the last 15 yrs but i have to say this will probably be my last stay as there are others in the area that are similar in price and the staff are more professional. When your staying somewhere for 2 weeks holiday you expect it to be home from home and clean and comfortable but i cannot say this hotel offered that and several people i spoke to agreed and felt the same after all it isnt a motel and we wernt there for a night. Two years ago this hotel was amazing we even got a pillow menu, suprised how much its changed. Very disappointed as this was a well planned family holiday and the hotel let us down. Apart from all this our holiday was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnroFlorida
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay upon returning to Orlando from vacation. Obtained this property through priceline and was pleased with the property. The hotel has been remodeled but this is an older property and not even the most extensive remodeling is going to change that. However, that being said the hotel did well with the work that has been done and the room in particular met my expectations and having a private balcony helped surpass what I was looking for. Very nice and large pool, hot tub area - unfortunately it rained the day I was there so I didn't have a chance to use the pool. Hotel does have 2 towers - my preference would be the first tower as it is closest to the lobby and doesn't seem to be as isolated as the 2nd tower could be. Staff was just awesome - answered any questions and even went out of their way to hold my briefcase behind the front desk while I walked to the car to get one more item. Room size was fine especially given that you have a balcony as well - only the bathroom seemed on the small side but not to much the hotel can do it about that and it certainly woudn't impact my decision not to stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience while staying here..”
Reviews.Author: poconofive
Reviews.Content: We were on the 2nd floor & able to access the outdoors off our balcony. That's a big plus! The staff was courteous, just didn't care for the hostess telling us to get our welcome bag to find out we were being talked into a timeshare program..that was a turn-off. The outdoor pool was very clean & enjoyable. The only gripes we had were first & foremost the bathroom. Truly, I have never been in a hotel room with a bathroom so small.
