When I say elbow to elbow, I am not kidding. Big disadvantage to the room. Also, the fact that most people are there vacationing with family, the room didn't have a microwave or frig. You can get them for $5 per night for each. They should come with the room. All in all though, the hotel was very clean & we enjoyed our stay. Would we go back? Probably not because of the bathroom being so small. My husband is a big guy & was not too happy!

Reviews.Title: “New nice rooms, good location, go somewhere else for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Business_or_leisure
Reviews.Content: New nice rooms - with emphasis on new. Because they dont have a fridge nor microwave. And even coffe maker is SUPER BASIC. You can only make 1 cup of coffee at a time, as the maker does not have a jar, and you have to put a plastic cup for coffee to go down. Very strange saving given very nice beds and furniture around... If we are on the rooms - biggest downside is service. We were 3 in the room - but we always (4 nights) were getting 1 small bottle of shampoo/gel (1 bottle combined - not 1 of each). Fine, we used soap... At least there were always 4 bathing towels fresh. But to make things even housekeeping did not replace our cofee cups and after last room service we had none. We went down to receiption to ask for them - got them easily - but no sorry or anything. However, most of the time, front desk was SUPER nice. Expect a knock on your door between 9 and 10 if you dont put "dont disturb outside". Good location close to Disney (15 min by car), but dont count on the shuttle. To Magic Kingdom it goes at 8:20 (early, isnt it?) or 12:20 (quite late). And comes back either at 6pm or at 10pm. Other location served is Epcat - I think 10:30 am in and 9:30pm back. Sea World is 15$ per person - cheaper to park there... Most importantly, go somewhere else for breakfast. American hot breakfast with saussages and hot egs for only 10$ + tax. Sounds good? Not really. After 10am it was cold and half empty. I asked if I can still make myself a waffle (no more cups with solution) - lady was surprised there is none at first, than looked at the watch, made a strange look on the face... said yes sir... and never brought anything. Facing the hotel, on your left, within 3 min walk there is Ponderosa with breakfast at 3.99 $. You say Ponderosa food is rubbish? Still better than the breakfast at the hotel... Net, nice stay if you go to Disney parks and Seaworld. But eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ottawasunseekersouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 23 to the 28th and enjoyed our stay. We originally booked the 2 queen bed room as I really wanted a balcony but when we checked in they offered us an upgrade at no extra charge to the kids suite with bunk beds which includes the fridge. It turned out that the fridge was leaking and started to smell by our second night, they replaced it and the smell was gone. I wished the patio doors opened but I understand for safety reasons they don't. Our room was facing the 192 highway so the traffic noise at night can get annoying but after a long day at the parks you fall asleep fast anyway. The pool was great and the kids really loved it. Parking was limited to none when returning to the hotel after 11:00pm. We had a fun filled holiday and really only went back to the hotel to sleep so we didn’t spend much time hanging around the hotel during the day. We will stay here again and next time I would like to get a room facing the pool with a balcony so I can enjoy some fresh air in the evenings while the kids sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel off site of the parks”
Reviews.Author: suchabigboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Maingate East for Easter week and it was a full house. We had the room with the bunk beds and it was cozy. Bathroom was tiny but usable as long as you can fit inside and shut the door still! Had a problem the whole time we were there with the AC and they came up one time but didn't fix or offer to move us. Luckily it wasn't too hot but unfortunately you cannot open the sliding glass doors on the front rooms on the first level - security, I guess. Other than the roach we saw crawl across the wall it was a clean hotel. We did not eat at the on-site restuarant but it looked nice. Kids loved the pool and it was heated. Concierge area trys to sell you discounted park tickets in exchange for listening to time share stuff at a place 15mins away. Wouldn't do it the tickets weren't that big of a discount for my time loss. We enjoyed the closeness to the parks, shopping (we loaded up our fridge at the Walgreens up the street - they even carry beer) and many restuarants on the main drive there too. *Don't depend on the gift shop/grocery in the hotel lobby - it cost me $15 the first morning for 4 - 16oz drinks/milk and 2 juice. We had a rental car and it came in handy and we also didn't want to be prisoner to the shuttle bus times for your park visits. For the $50 rate per nite that I got online - it was well worth the value!

Reviews.Title: “Great value option for families”
Reviews.Author: familyfromoz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for a 3 star property. Pool and hot tub nice after walking about. Close to Old Town plenty of dining options near by. Factory Outlets and Disney parks are covered by free shuttles. We had a family room with a bunk and queen size bed with a dividing wall next to the bunk. This was a great option for a young family. There is also an Alamo Car Rental Agency on site.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but watch for the ol' Room Type switch upon arrival.....”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDisneyFam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with family of 4 and specifically chose this hotel due to value and the fact that it offered the "Kidsuites" with a queen bed seperated from a set of bunk beds by a dividing wall. I booked through Holiday Inn directly and specifically told the rep. that the ONLY reason I chose this hotel was for the Kidsuite and specifically asked if I was going to get to the hotel and be told I was in a different room type. "Absolutely not. You are confirmed for the Kidsuite." It was important to us that for an 8 night stay the kids had their own beds, etc. After driving 13 hours I arrive at the hotel at 7:30 and what am I told....we're in a room with two double beds. I explained that I had specifically been told during the reservation process that I was booked in the Kidsuite and even had a confirmation email which stated "KIdsuite" and there was no "legalize" stating that the room type was not confirmed as they tried to tell me on site. I was then told that I could stay the night and then look for alternative accomodations....Are you kidding me? "Sorry....stay someplace else." After demanding to see the manager, another clerk was able to do some typing and magically find us a Kidsuite. Not an experience anyone needs after being on the road for two days. After getting this resolved we were happy with the room, the cleanliness, and the location. Be aware...it is right across the street from a small amusement park which generates a lot of noise and we were treated nightly to the sounds of motorcycle engines whining outside the hotel. For some reason, they also decided to do some landscaping at 5:00 a.m. and we were treated to the sound of a gas powered trimmer seemingly right outside our window even though we were on a mid-level floor. Kids Eat Free was a bit misleading. This hotel has a food court with Pizza Hut and A&W which the deal does not apply at. You must eat in a sit-down dining area and order an "entree" off a menu for a minimum $10.99 to qualify for a free item off the kid's menu. Staff didn't really seem to know what the deal was as we got different answers from several different staff. These were our only disappointments as the only real time we spent at the hotel was sleeping. The pool was adequate with a small playground off the side for little ones. We ended our stay relatively happy with the hotel mainly due to convenience to Disney and the price and the Kidsuites are great for families with kids who need seperate beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at this price point”
Reviews.Author: Clavius27
Reviews.Content: I booked our room on Priceline.com for a big savings. We received a large room with a kitchenette (full size refrigerator, sink, and microwave). Besides a king bed, the room had a sofa bed, desk, and 2 chairs. I'd guess the room was refurnished about 2 years ago, so the decor was contemporary with relatively little wear. The hotel had everything we needed for our 5 day stay. The business center has PC's with printers available for rent if you need to print your boarding passes or order theme park tickets on-line. The main desk attendants can print your airline boarding passes for free. The is a cafe on the 1st floor which serves a buffet breakfast for $9, but we chose to buy our food from a nearby Publix market and eat in the room to save time. There are many inexpensive restaurants within walking distance. The hotel has a small bar adjacent to the large pool. The gift shop has a fair selection of boxed foods, ice cream, toiletries, etc. There is a small resort fee of about $6/day. I generally do not like paying these, but $6 is on the low end of the scale and the hotel has free parking and free wireless internet. Overall, this is a very nice 3 1/2 star hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs awful”
Reviews.Author: AustinSilus
Reviews.Content: My stay would have been fine in this hotel, but about a month after I got home, we got bed bugs. This is the only hotel I've stayed at in the last 6 months so they had to come from here. Considering the previous bed bug complaint, I'm confident this is where they came from. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL unless you are prepared to deal with the bed bugs. It has cost us at least $5k trying to get rid of them in our house now.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a small family”
Reviews.Author: dlbDisney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as a high school trip for Festyival Disney.My family came and stayed in another room.They were upgraded to a suite with the bunkbeds.The bathroom and room is very small and with 2 adults and 2 teens it was quite cramped for the 1 night we were all together. I could not imagine staying in that room for a whole week.My husband and dtr did ok with just the 2 of them though so II suppose with 2 adults and 1 child it would be ok. My room was a 2 queen bed and was the average motel type room with a fridge.The beds in both rooms were very comfy.The location though could not be beat.I would not take the shuttles. They do not run frequent enough and return too early,600 pm when the parks close at 900 or 1000 pm.At most the farthest park was 15 minutes by car.I missed being on Disney property but this hotel was ok.The pool area was nice but again just a regular pool and spa.No resort feel to it at all.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel worked hard to earn one star!”
Reviews.Author: tripadvesq
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the Holiday Inn Main Gate East on a prepaid for two nights in March, 2009 while I was in town for the Space Shuttle launch. This hotel uses many internet resources to fill every room. If you get there late, you will not get your choice of bed and you may not even get a non-smoking room. I am an attorney and this hotel earned one star from me for what I will be soon exploring with class action lawyers is allegedly illegal activities. I prepaid for the room through Priceline--non-refundable. I did not have the choice of hotel and with Priceline--it is not refundable. The hotel required that give them my credit card during check in, which is not required by Priceline but is not an uncommon practice. The credit card is to cover any damage to the room if you cause any, if you use the phone, use room service, etc. It is to cover costs that YOU INTENTIONALLY and AFFIRMATIVELY INCUR. When I went to check out, they billed to my credit card and additional aprox. $6.00 a day for a total of $12.00 dollars for an alleged, "resort fee" , even though this hotel is not a resort and at no time did I use the pool or any of the facilities. A hotel with a pool and spa does not = a resort. I objected to the clerk and then the manager on duty, but she failed to remove the extra charges. I warned her that I will pursue legal action regarding this behavior. She claimed that it is the policy of this Holiday Inn to charge Priceline customers extra fees upon checkout even though they do not have the choice of hotel or the ability to cancel the reservation and receive a refund and even though they have no idea what the Hotel extra "mandatory" fees are going to be until it is too late.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: meena482
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in March. We purchased the room for $35 from Priceline. The rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel was close to all of the things we wanted to do: Disney Parks, Universal and Downtown Disney. It was also close to shopping and eating places. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the Disney Parks, but it was so busy that we decided to drive (15-20 minutes). The only problem we encountered while staying there was that our room keys did not work consistently. I think the lock needed to be replaced. Just a minor annoyance though.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn was a good value”
Reviews.Author: missmc123
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at this hotel for $42 from priceline. I found that the location was excellent as it is very close to all the Disney Parks. There are tons of restaurants in the area, as well as a Pizza Hut right in the hotel itself. The hotel facility looks nice and there is a small pool. The rooms were typical Holiday Inn quality, with typical Holiday Inn quality toiletries. The faults I found with the hotel were the paper thin walls where I could hear the noisy people coming and going at late hours. I would recommend this hotel for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4 had a great time in the kids suites”
Reviews.Author: jcpallas
Reviews.Content: We came with our 7 year old twins to go to the parks. Our main goal was to have a room for sleep but also so our kids would have fun with it. The bunks are great kids absolutely loved it. We had no problems with the hotel that was so bad we wouldn't recommend it. Yes the coffee maker is small, but who cares it made coffee. The bathroom is small but how much time do you spend in it. The lighting was not so great either but like I said we weren't there to spend the day in the room. Rooms were clean nicely kept and newer looking furniture. Also close to several shopping and eating areas. McDonald's is right next door so walking there was great. Nice hotel for the price. Charter bus schedule was great to the parks. Worked great for us.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: relaxedtrip
Reviews.Content: just had a superb 10 days chez holiday inn. we had a kids suite which perfectly hived off the little one. bathroon is small but does not matter given the fact that you are out all day! Rooms were clean and smartly done out and hotel staff were courteous and v helpful. The only thing before more positives is that all the kids suites face the highway so can be a bit noisy in the evening. I suspect the south tower block is quiet. the proximity to the parks is great and there are no problems finding places to eat. Recommend longhorns and charleys steakhouse, also angelinas family diner in celebration. Also there is a large publix supermarket 2 blocks up on the same side so get all your stuff there (fridge in room) as the nearby grocery stores are grotty! Had a great stay and specifically chose the place because of the kids suite!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: drinxx
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel at 1am after my original hotel.... the Royal Parc Suites (across the street) dropped the ball and gave me not 1, but 2 disgusting rooms with sticky floors and unclean sheets. Anyway.... I arrived at The Holiday Inn and right from the start the front desk staff were very helpful at getting me a room, even though I did not have a reservation with them. The room was spacious and VERY clean. No hairs in the tub from previous guests. No hairs or stains on the bedding. And most of all, I could not find a speck of dust anywhere in the room. My only complaints would be that the air conditioning did not work that well. The knobs were broken, and it just wouldn't get cold. Luckily I had a balcony door that I was able to open to let some cooler air in. I was also a bit surprised that as nice as the room was, there was no refridgerator or microwave. Costwise, comparable hotels in the area provide these amenities in the rooms. I guess they have excluded these due to the fact that they offer room service..... So they probably don't want you bringing outside food back to the room to eat later on in hopes of the guests ordering room service instead. A note to the hotel.... Your guests would appreciate not having to keep baby formula or diabetic medications in the ice bucket throughout their stay. I can forgive the lack of a microwave, but for the price you are charging, there should be a fridge in every room. One last note about the room..... The balcony overlooking the pool area is a nice addition. However, be sure to watch small children when out there because the bars on the railing are spaced rather wide. It is also not a very high railing. I'm only pointing that out because tourists and vacationers tend to have a very laxed attitude while on vacation, and common sense is often neglected as a result. As for the location..... Old Town is directly across the street and McDonalds is literally right next door. There are many other restaurants along the strip as well. If you like lobster and crab legs, check out Angels Buffet which is about 10 minutes down the road. Unlike other buffets this buffet never runs out of those two main items. Most of the other items on their buffet are mediocre, but it's good if you like lobster and crab. DINING WARNING - - - Stay away from Captain Nemo's Buffet. It's GROSS!!!! I would compare it to the buffet in the National Lampoon's Vegas Vacation movie where Cousin Eddie (Randy Quaid) tells the server.... "I'll have some of the yella". UGH!!! You're better off eating out of the garbage cans at the McDonalds. Be sure to visit Old Town. Check out the gem shop.... Get some popcorn from the specialty popcorn place...... Grab an A&W root beer float from A&W..... And Ride the bull if you're up for it. Don't bother with the haunted house or the wax museum as they are tourists traps and are REALLY not worth the money. That's about it I guess. I visit Orlando at least once a month. I've stayed at many of the area hotels and have dined at just about every restaurant. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPANISHSUE
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the Holiday Inn over christmas and new year and the hotel was excellent. We had a room in block 1 overlooking the pool with 2 beds. The room was clean and nicely decorated with bedding and towels changed frequently. The bathroom is on the small side but for the time you are in there who cares. The staff especially in the bar are very friendly and helpful and the decoration throughout the hotel, is very nice.The situation of the hotel is brillant, just 10 mins by car to Disney World. Breakfast in the hotel is the only thing not worth having, not a lot of choice for the price. The Golden Corral is just a few minutes down the road and offers a far better selection. Overall the hotel is excellent and having just got back we are already looking to book for this coming christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlsousa
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself were traveling with 3 yr & 6yr old boys and we rented this room for the week. We got the kids suite that had the bunk beds on the other side of a wall which allowed the kids to have their own TV. The room also came with fridge. The hotel desk help was extremely friendly. The rooms were clean and the beds were very soft and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and spacious. I liked the fact that the kids beds had big fluffy down comforters that made the kids feel like they were sleeping with a cloud. I made sure I inspected the bed sheets before laying in them for the first time and they were clean. I would say that their maids could have been a tad more thorough when they cleaned the room daily. It was clean but they missed 2 cans of empy soda, and on one day they put 2 comforters on the bottom bunk and none on the top. Nothing to really complain about. I did use the business center and had no problems with the card reader thing that another person complained about. The selection of food on the breakfast buffet was wide also. Overall, a nice, clean, friendly hotel that I wasn't afraid to give my kids baths in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EllieMae28
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay at the Holiday Inn Maingate East in Kissimmee through BookIt.com and I have to say, I was really impressed. My husband and I and our two daughters headed down for a relaxing long weekend and we were expecting a run of the mill, average hotel, nothing special. The Holiday Inn exceeded our expectations and we would return in a heartbeat. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help, the front desk manager even personally saw to it that we got on the free transportation to the parks, and ran back inside to get us a schedule for our return. Our room was super clean, with great amenities and a really comfortable bed. The girls even had their own bunk beds! The whole experience was really fun and the Holiday Inn provided us with a great home base to return to after our time in the parks! Would absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: jw2190
Reviews.Content: Overall this was not a good hotel. I would not reccomend it to anyone. The first issue we had was with the room itself. The bathroom was so tiny that you could not close the door if you were using the restroom. It was very cramped. We found hairs in the sheets on the bed, and they were not ours. The hotel states that it has a business center where internet can be used. This was not the case. The machines in the business center where you must purchase cards to use the internet were not even functioning. The hotel dining area was also terribly overpriced. My biggest complaint about the hotel was the area in the lobby where you can purchase tickets for the theme parks. My husband and I thought it would be a good idea to purchase tickets before we went to the park. We went to see the gentlemen who was busy helping a woman and completely ignored us for a good ten minutes. Then he quoted us a price for the tickets which was higher than the price that we would have been charged at the gate. We did not purchse our tickets at the hotel and went to the park and ended up saving 15.00 by purchasing our tickets at the gate, this was for a Disney theme park. I find that this was highly unethical and reported a complaint with Disney as they are a Disney partner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: jayniecakes
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel...we had to re-book our holiday to Florida as we were one of the XL customers where our original booking got cancelled...we booked this through expedia and we were not disappointed. The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly (especially at guest services), the amenities were great and the hotel room was fantastic. We had 2 queen/king (not quite sure what size) beds, a good bathroom and a balcony with a view to the pool. We have got nothing to complain about at all, it really was an enjoyable stay and we would most deffinatley stay here again, infact, i can not wait to book our next trip to Florida and we will deffinatley be coming back to this hotel. RECOMMENDED FOR EVERYBODY.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAGNERS0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 9 years ago when it was the Travelodge. At this time it was myself, husband and two teenage boys. We loved it then so when we decided to return to Florida (my husband and I were accompanying our friends on their honeymoon) I had no hesitation in booking this hotel. I know it changed companies and has been refurbished but it was still the same hotel we loved back then. We initially stayed for three nights, then moved north to St Augustine and Amelia Island (both well worth a visit). After travelling to Georgia and S Carolina we returned to Kissimmee and managed to get the last 8 nights of our holiday at the hotel. The new bride was so terified there would be no vacancies she did not get out of the car until it was confirmed they had two suites for us. The hotel is in a great area with the Old Town just across the road and the parks also so near. The staff were all so friendly especially Vanessa the receptionist, who gave us a lesson on how to get our eyebrows perfect, Thomas and Xiomara in the restuarant who served us every day and always had time for a chat. (PS if you are fed up with the buffet breakfast the hotel had nice and cheap breakfast items you can order separately). We paid only 60 dollars plus taxes for each room which contained a queen bed, usual shower/bathroom, hairdryer, microwave, fridge and coffee machine, only down side was no breakfast included. I would have no hesitation in recomending this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! Stay here....”
Reviews.Author: Tunes07
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there the second time. My son absolutely loves the bunkbed rooms. My friend stayed in a double room and it was nice as well. All these rooms look practically brand new. The bathroom area is small. The beds are comfy and they have nice bath products by Garden Botanika. The pool has a poolside bar that opens around noon and they have great frozen drinks. They also have a courtyard with pizza hut in the hotel. McDonalds is right next door too! Everytime I plan on being the area this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: TheMorins
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn MainGate East was recently renovated and has impecible rooms and public areas. We arrived on a Fiday and although they were 100% booked, (it was Cheer Week at Disney)everything was running smoothly. They have a Pizza Hut and A&W in the hotel which were pretty convenient. The room was spacious and very clean. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flatraveler032
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline.com and wasn't to sure about what I was in for until I got there. What a wonderful surprise! First, you're greeted by one of the friendliest front desk staff I have ever encountered. They truly take their time to go over all the details and make any necessary arrangements and accomodate special requests. Next, you arrive at a spacious room with a great balcony! The rooms have very comfy beds, everything is clean, new coffeemakers, hair dryers and iron/ironing board. Great amenities with only one downfall - very small bathrooms. The overall facilities were very clean. Breakfast buffet is not too expensive and food was hot and fresh. Great service everywhere we went around the hotel. I would strongly recommend it for someone wanting to be close to Disney in a comfortable and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: jwinkers
Reviews.Content: we just got home from our stay at holiday inn main gate east, we were booked at the travelodge maingate east orange and because of their reviews changed at the last minute, we were very happy that we had. we had four adults and four children(8, 7, 5, and 3 years old). the floors were clean, bathrooms were nice, beds VERY comfortable, the pool was just right for the kids to cool down after the heat at disney, breakfast buffet was good as well, kids eat with a paying adult, the towels in the rooms are large as well, they try to slip in a resort fee, which we asked to speak with a manager right when we got there and he waived this because we had booked with travel agent and were under the understanding that no other fees were to be charged. you do need to request to have a fridge placed in your room for a fee of 5.95 daily, which we were also not charged. Beware of taking your own towels to the pool though, we had two stolen and got one back as we were leaving. we had our own rental which i recommend beacuse the one night 4 of us took the shuttle, we were supposed to be picked up at 9:45 which we were but never got back to hotel until 11:10, this is shared with othe hotels and ours was dropped off last. Overall we would stay there again if needed, when you are paying for two rooms because of kids this is a great buy! PS give the help even a dollar tip and they are so thankful!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!! Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: ledwardsga
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after leaving the funspot! this was wonderful change. Rooms we clean and comfortable, staff was great it saved our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Jen08610
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 7th-13th for a family reunion and the hotel was very nice. We received a rate of $79 plus resort fee & tax. The hotel had a shuttle to Disney which I didn't use but some of my family members used it. It's surrounded by various restaurants within walking distance. There is also a food court at the hotel but it's over priced so most of the time I ate elsewehere. Across the street is Old Town which is like a carnival, again I didn't go over there but some of my family members did. I spent most of my time at the Disney Parks which is about 10-15 minutes away. I don't have any complaints and I found that the hotel was adequate enough to fit my needs as well as my other family members needs. I did have an issue with my A/C which was leaking, I notifed the front desk and by the time I came back from the parks it was fixed. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it was really nice...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: sisley80
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the phone & the reps kept telling me different rates...(should've just done it on-line) I ended up booking for the march break and we got a fairly descent rate...hotel was easy to find...they had shuttles to and from the hotel to Disney World (at set times - they also stopped at other hotels to do pick ups there - 30 mins or so, total trip) which was fantastic! The hotel and staff were very helpful...rooms were clean. We didn't spend much time in our room...but the fact that we could retreat to a secure and clean setting to sleep and relax was comforting. Recommended for all demographics!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: UkEvh
Reviews.Content: We booked to go to Florida back in March and was disappointed by some of the reviews written by people. The hotel was just what you need for a base hotel (especially if you are visiting theme parks daily). Disney is located literally 5 minutes away and universal and seaworld are a short distance away. The hotel is surrounded by various restaurants from Pizza Hut to Red Lobster. Breakfast is recommended at Ponderossa or Denny's both a short walk away and a lot cheaper than the hotel. The only downside we found was the $3.95 daily resort fee which included use of pool and car parking. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job it needed to”
Reviews.Author: shwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the property for our first family vacation - my wife and I with our 2 and 4 year old. We booked directly so we could get the kid suite with the bunk bed - paid 89 per night with a AAA discount. That suite was not available from any online disount site. Very close to Disney - only about 2 miles from the main freeway entrance. Lots of food choices close by. Steer clear of the guest services/ concierge. They are a time share outfit. They will sell tickets for regular price, which was fine, but they gave us misinformation about what they gave us. It ended up costing us another hour and more money to fix the problems at the Disney gate. Bunk bed suite was small but sufficient. If you have light sleeping kids, maybe make another choice. Only a 3/4 high wall between "rooms" so the light and sound comes over. Our kids are deep sleepers so they did great. Based on my kids' love for the bunks, we will consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and clean!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DanBooth
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from this hotel and cant highly enough of it. The rooms were spottlessly clean and the staff very helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this to any one, its bang across the road from Kissimmee old town, next door to Mcdonalds, a 5 - 10 minute drive to the disney parks. The pools were well maintained. I cant seem to think of anything to complain of................hope you enjoy this hotel as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “They try don't deliver”
Reviews.Author: salzaknhoj
Reviews.Content: The place is newly painted and has new baths & furnishings, but that doesn't make it a 3 Star Hotel. The elevators break down daily and the air conditioners are all old worn out pices of noisy junk. The Guest Services Desk is really a front for a Time Share offering. The Holiday Inn web site shows that all guest rooms have refrigerators but when you check in you find out only the suites & excutive rooms do. The staff acts like they care but after seven days and problems don't get fixed, you wonder if they really do care. After spending 7 nights here I find that I'll never do it again and I doubt I'll ever use Priceline again either

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean”
Reviews.Author: Capitol_Explorer
Reviews.Content: For what it was, this place is great. It is centrally located to Disney World. It is very clean and newly renovated. The pool was great. Big clean and attractive. The lobby had a bar, pizza hut and an A&W. Perfect for a family. The roomservice menu was the most reasonably priced room service menu I have ever seen. $5 for a order of pancakes... Parking was free. Kids had a game room and a small movie theatre. The only reason I would not give it more than three stars is that the area is very touristy and very cheesy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, No Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: JW82
Reviews.Content: We Pricelined this hotel for $50 a night for 2 nights. I was slightly concerned when I found out we would be at this hotel then read some negative reviews online (esp the ones about bed bugs!!). I am happy to report that we had no problems (no insects!). The hotel is at most a 10 minute commute to Disney, which was the reason for our trip. We didn't try the shuttle that runs once or twice a day b/c we wanted the freedom of having our own car. The room was updated, nicely decorated, and bathroom was large and clean (I had read several reviews complaining bathrooms were tiny). There is no complimentary breakfast, but there is a buffet at a restaurant in the hotel. We ate breakfast for around $25, which we thought was too much. We went to the McDonald's next door for breakfast the next morning. Anyway, the room certainly met our expectations for a 2.5 star hotel for $50 per night! No disappointments here.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE MOTEL that dares to charge a RESORT FEE!”
Reviews.Author: puysan81
Reviews.Content: this is a mediocre hotel at best. i've stayed at really nice Holiday Inn Expresses before and this fell short by a lot. Neighbor in the next room blasted their radio at 5:45am, contacted staff and it took them a long time to respond. The motel had the balls to charge us a 5.95 daily RESORT fee, this was far from a definition of a RESORT! I asked the manager what it included and she told me in vague terms it was for the amentities. WHAT AMENTITIES? The pool? The over priced internet? No breakfast? What kind of ripoff is this? I'd chose the Hampton Inn or similar over this anyday

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: greenart5
Reviews.Content: I can start by highly recommending that you ask for a room away from the main highway. I asked for a quiet room, and was given one away from the visiting school groups. However, it faced the main road. I heard loud cars, screams from the amusement park, and ambulances all night. To make things worse, the drapes don't close all the way, nor are they made to. The sheers don't provide enough coverage to keep out the flashing lights from the businesses and amusement park. (It was some sort of local park). Aside from the noise, the hotel was just fine. My room was really, really clean and comfortable. The beds were great. I didn't try out the restaurant or the pool. The front desk receptionists were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: AnonVirginia
Reviews.Content: Husband, daughter and I stayed three nights for spring break. We had stayed in this property several times before (when daughter was younger) back when it was a Travelodge which was getting pretty run-down. Now that it is a Holiday Inn, it is spruced up and very nice for the price. The room was very clean, beds were comfortable, water pressure in shower was good and free wireless internet in room was great. (Used this to take advantage of online discount for Medieval Times dinner show.) The Kissimmee location is just what we like - midway between Disney, Seaworld and Universal and near almost every type of restaurant known up and down the Irlo Bronson Highway. If memory serves, if you ask for a room on the higher floors facing the rear parking lot, you can watch the fireworks from both Magic Kindom and Epcot in the evenings, although they are fairly far away. The pool is nice, and pool towels are provided. Although I had to go ask that the pool towels be replenished one night. (The management had to have known because they had posted "wet floor" signs along the tiled (and slippery) hallway between the door from the pool and the elevator where towel-less people were dripping.) There is also a hot tub and a fitness center overlooking the pool, but we didn't use those. Parking is outdoor, free and plentiful. There is a shuttle to the parks, but we chose to drive ourselves and not be tied to their schedule. There is a tourist desk in the lobby, but their discounts aren't as good as what you can find online. The only sour note in our stay was upon checkin. One is apparently unable to use the luggage carts without the supervision of a bellman, who has his hand out before he even loads your luggage. I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Main Gate East
HotelInfo.Address: 5711 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway (US 192), Kissimmee, FL 34746
